"You girls know that your mother and I met in college," Dad explained. "But what you don't know is that we both minored in parapsychology. We were fascinated by the supernatural: ghosts,... werewolves,... vampires,... "

That part got my attention.

"We used to wonder what it would be like to meet one," Dad continued. "Be careful what you wish for, huh?"

"Don't be too regretful, Stephen," Mom said. "Sure, if we hadn't been so curious, Janelle wouldn't be a vampire, but that's because she wouldn't exist. I'm glad things happened the way they did. If having a vampire for a daughter was the price we paid for our family, then I'd pay it again."
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: A Surprise Revelation

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Finola met me on the way to my car. "D'ye have a moment, then?" she asked.

"Not many," I replied, "I'm on my way to work."

"It's come to my attention," she said, "that you've had contact with a Lycan."

"I don't think so. I'm not sure I could even find Lycan on a map."

"Don't be thick, colleen. Lycan is short for lycanthrope. 'Tis werewolves I'm talking about."

"Oh."

"D'you realize that vampires and werewolves have strictly avoided each other for centuries? It's established tradition! It's the way we do things!" She sighed. "And, in the opinion of a good many, it's bloody banjaxed."

"I'm sorry, it's what now?"

"It's broken, useless. Now, listen: When your da is having trouble with his car, he goes looking for a new one. But he doesn't go in blind, does he? He asks about, wants to know how other cars stack up. Then, when he's sure, he gets a new car.

"So it is with us and the truce. Only we've got devil a one to ask about another way." She pointed at me. "That's where you come in."

"Me? I'm a cabbie, not a diplomat."

"You're what we've got, so it has to be enough. You're our other car owner. You can tell us what works, and what doesn't work." She put her hands on my shoulders. "You and this Lycan girl will be our secret diplomats. You carry on talking, sounding each other out. Then, you will tell me, and she will tell my sister, what's the craic. If it all works out, the two of you will go down as the ones who led us to peace."

Just then, my phone rang. I checked it. "It's Tasha."

"Answer."

I did. "Hello?"

"Janelle, you're not going to believe this, but an Irish vampire whose name I can't pronounce wants me to be a diplomat."

"That would be my sister, Aoife," Finola said.

"As you might have gathered," I said, "it's a bit easier for me to believe than you thought. So, what do you say?"

"I guess I'm in."

"Ditto. Call me tomorrow afternoon, we'll start figuring this out."
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Finola Wants to Talk

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The next afternoon was the first time since I became a vampire that Courtney was not allowed into the rec room. "How come?" she demanded. "I thought you liked hanging out with me?"

"I do," I replied. "But today isn't a hanging-out kind of day. Today is... You know how vampires and werewolves have been avoiding each other for centuries, right?"

"Duh."

"Well, there are those who believe that it's time for a change. And they want me to take point."

"Why you?"

"Because I just happen to know a werewolf. And she's coming over this afternoon. Which is why you can't be down here."

At that moment, there was a knock on the rec room door, and Tasha came in, with a younger boy in tow. "Hey, Janelle," she said. "This is my little brother, Matt. My mom made me bring him along."

"Hey, Tasha. Hey, Matt. This is my little sister, Courtney. She needs something to do, too."

Courtney went up the stairs. "I guess it's my job to keep you entertained." She took Matt by the hand and led him off.

With those two out of our hair, Tasha turned to me. "So," she asked, "how much did they tell you about the start of the vampire/werewolf feud?"

"Not a thing. You?"

"Ditto. How are we supposed to create peace, when we don't even know why there was a war?"

"Dunno. Finola just said she wanted us to try being friends, and that I should tell her what works and what doesn't."

"They sure are confident in our abilities, aren't they?"

"I'm not sure it's a question of confidence. Vampires and werewolves haven't been getting along for centuries, millennia, even. Maybe we're the first ones who were on a first-name basis."

Tasha nodded. "I heard about this one thrall, they wouldn't turn him into a werewolf, because he was going out with a vampire. A culture like that, it's gotta be hard to break through."

And so the two of us talked, working on our friendship, and hoping that the feud would take care of itself.
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Supernatural Diplomacy

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
As our little get-together drew to its close, I saw Tasha to the rec room door. "I liked this," I said. "Maybe, next time, we can make it a girls' night out."

"I'd like that, too," Tasha replied. She checked her smartphone. "I've got a couple nights off coming before the moon. I'll call you later, and we can set it up."

The hallway was dark, so I was able to give her a hug before she left.

Mom came along. "How did everything go?"

"I think it went well, Mrs. Lee. Thanks for having us over. I hope Matt wasn't too difficult for you."

"Not at all. They've been sitting quietly this whole time."

I peeked out. Matt and Courtney were sitting together on the sofa.

Matt had his arm around my sister.

"Feck," I said.

Everyone turned to look at me.

"Sorry," I said. "I must have picked it up from Finola." Clearing my throat, I called out, "What are your intentions toward my sister?"

They both jumped. "We... we weren't doing anything," Matt stammered. "We were just... just sitting here."

"We'll talk about this later, Matt," Tasha said. Turning back to Mom, she said, "Thanks again for having us, Mrs. Lee. You have a lovely home."

After our guests left, Courtney turned to me. "What's the big idea? I thought you were going for peace between vampires and werewolves, and then you pull this shi-uh, stuff?" she said, quickly looking at Mom.

"This isn't about vampires and werewolves," I replied. "He's a boy."

"No clue is too small for Janelle Lee," she replied, sarcasm dripping from her lips. "I had actually figured that one out for myself, thank you very much."

"I just don't want you getting hurt. You're still just a kid."

"I'm the same age you were when you and Brad started. You didn't think you were a kid, then."

I looked at Mom. She nodded. "You said much the same thing, minus the vampires and werewolves, but with the sarcasm. Should I not have listened to that 14-year-old girl?"

I calmed down, ashamed of myself. "I just got scared for you, Court," I said. "You're the only one who can give Mom and Dad grandchildren. I just didn't want you doing that before you were ready."

"If you think having a boy's arm around you is what gets girls pregnant - "

"You know what I meant."

"I know. But, just like I'm not that fertile that any physical contact will get me pregnant, I'm not that fragile, either. And even if it goes bad, I've got to go through that, too. Just like you had your rough patches with Brad. How many arguments did you have with him over the years, over what he did when he wasn't with you?"

"Too many," I replied, remembering them all. Eventually, I learned to accept that there were things Brad couldn't tell me, but that didn't mean he was cheating on me.

And then I remembered something Tasha had mentioned in passing, about a thrall to werewolves who was dating a vampire. Hmmm,...
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Other Developments

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
On our next date night, I decided to test my theory. "I'm hanging out with Tasha more," I said to Brad. "She's a werewolf."

"Oh?" he asked. "Oh, really?" If I didn't already have my suspicions, Brad would have given them to me.

"She told me a very interesting story," I continued, "about a thrall to werewolves who lost his status with the pack. You'll never guess why."

"Why?"

"He fell in love with a vampire. Touching story, right?"

"She told you that?! I can't believe it. Here I am, honor-bound to keep the secrets of the pack, and she - " He turned to me. "She never said it was me, did she?"

I shook my head. "She never even suggested it. If I hadn't been reminded of my jealous streak by Courtney, I never would have made the connection. For all I knew, it was an old story." I put my arm around him. "Want to talk about it?"

"Not much I can say. Honor-bound, remember? But, yeah, I can't join the pack because my girlfriend is a vampire."

"After years of refusing to answer her questions, no less," I said. "How do you feel?"

He put his arm around me. "Lighter. I thought it was a cliche, but it really does feel like a weight has been taken off my shoulders."

I kissed his cheek. "And I've got my boyfriend back. So, this raises the question, doesn't it?"

"What question?"

"Am I worth it?"

He smiled, and wrapped both arms around me. "Just say the word, and I'll gladly be your thrall."

"Maybe someday," I said, kissing him.
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Brad

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
I was off work again the next night, so I decided to take Mindy and Zooey out to a movie. I figured it was a good way to break it to them that they'd be seeing even less of me, at least for a while.

We saw If They Could See Me Now, about a girl who turns invisible. We enjoyed it.

After the movie, I spoke up. "There's a reason I took you girls out tonight."

"Here it comes," Zooey said.

"At least for a while, I won't be hanging out with you two so much."

"Wait, what?" Zooey asked.

"Why?" asked Mindy.

"Here's the deal: Besides vampires, it turns out that werewolves are also real, and the two groups have had an uneasy truce for centuries. Now, they want to make real peace, and they want my help to do it."

"Why you?"

"Because it turns out that I know a werewolf. Tasha Lyall didn't just hit the gym, get contacts, and find a great new skin cleanser: She was bitten by a werewolf on prom night, and now she's one of them."

"Tasha Lyall's a werewolf?" Mindy asked. "How do you know?"

"She may look normal to you," I explained, "but my vampire senses paint a different picture. We've had a couple of meetings, and we want to keep going. Who knows? If it works out right, Girls' Night Out just might include her and her friends."

"Well, we'll certainly miss our weekly get-togethers," Mindy said, "but we're glad you've been trusted with something so important."

Zooey nodded. "They picked the right vamp for the job."

"Thanks, girls. It's nice you feel that way. Now, what did you think I was going to talk to you two about?"

"Well,... " Zooey said, "we kind of thought that, maybe, you were going to ask us for our blood."

"Now that's a big discussion, one that's too important for Movie Night. Tell you what: If you want to talk to me about it - yes, no, you want more information - come by the house some afternoon, and we'll talk it out."
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Girls' Night Out

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The next night, I went back to my paying job. As I drove, I thought about how I was actually considering drinking directly from people - not just anyone, but three of the most important people in my existence. Moreover, they were thinking about it, too: in fact, they were the ones to suggest it.

My thoughts were pulled from my reverie when I saw two men beating a woman. Probably muggers, I thought as I parked. Little do they know they're not the most dangerous people out in the night.

I leaped across the street, landing right next to the action. "Let her go," I said, catching the scent of her blood.

One turned to me, waving a switchblade in my face. "Why don't you keep your nose out of other people's business, while it's still on your face?"

Maybe it was the smell of blood in the air, but I didn't feel like pretending I was a mortal human being. I bared my fangs. "You dare?"

He made a sound that caught the attention of his partner. Now I had them both.

Time for the ol' Jedi mind trick. "Return what you've stolen," I said, "and, maybe, I will permit you to live."

They didn't need to be told twice. Within seconds, the muggers had divested themselves of the woman's valuables, and ran off, praying that I would spare them.

I helped the woman to her feet. "I don't think they'll be - "

And that was as far as I got, after I saw her face.

I had just revealed my nature to my boss.
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Minor Scuffle , Major Consequences

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
I took Ham to Nouri's, the closest thing to neutral territory I could think of, to give her a chance to process it all.

"Let me get this straight," she said, nursing her coffee. "You're a... "

"Vampire, yes," I replied.

"How... ?"

"After graduating high school, I went out dancing. Eventually, I came across this underground rave and snuck in. I met a guy, we had some pleasant conversation, then he drugged my drink. He and three of his buddies turned out to be vampires, and they took me out back and bit me. The next thing I know, I'm in the morgue, waking up just in time to interrupt my own autopsy."

"Why are you working for me?"

I shrugged. "I needed a job where I wouldn't have to show up before the sun went down, or stick around after the sun came up. I figured I'd fit better as a cab driver than the other options. Are you gonna be okay?"

"Yeah, my nose has stopped bleeding."

"I mean with all this stuff. Is my being a vampire going to be a problem?"

She sighed. "When you walked in, I had my doubts. Some kid, still wet behind the ears, walks in and wants to drive? I literally expected you to either quit within a week or just stop showing up. But you stayed with it. You proved you were reliable, and I haven't had anybody complain about you. If I let you go, I'd have to be batshit. No offense."

"None taken. So we're good?"

She checked her watch. "You're running late."

"Sorry. I was taking care of a friend."
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Ham

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
I picked Tasha up at her house. "First thing," I said, "I'm sorry about last time. I overreacted."

"I understand," she replied. "You wanted to look out for your sister. Plus we've got to figure out how to hammer out a peace agreement."

"I've been thinking about that," I said. "They didn't really ask us to broker a peace deal. They just want to see if a vampire and a werewolf can be friends."

"So, we work on our friendship, and let them handle the big stuff?"

"Right."

"I can do that. How about a vampire's sister and a werewolf's brother?"

"Well, the vampire's sister has asked her to let her make mistakes. Who knows? It might work out like a werewolf thrall dating a vampire."

She groaned. "I thought I was so subtle."

"You were. I didn't think of it until I was reminded of how Brad wouldn't tell me where he was some nights."

We saw a movie about a girl who was turned into an alien. The two sides in the movie came into conflict, too, and the poor thing was in the middle of it.
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Next Meeting

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
"How'd it go?" Mom asked me, when I got home.

"It went well," I replied. "We've decided that we'll work on cultivating our friendship, and let the higher-ups forge a treaty when they see what friendship is like."

Down in the basement, I found Courtney in the rec room. "Hi," I said.

"Hi."

"So," I said, "there are a couple of reasons why I didn't take you along tonight. The first is, to punish myself for being such a bitch last time. The second is, I didn't want an audience when I apologized to Tasha, just like I don't want an audience now. I'm sorry, Courtney. I was completely out of line. I let my protective instincts get out of control, and you suffered for it. I was so tied up in knots over what could have gone wrong for you, I forgot that you can take care of yourself."

"I just don't get it," she said. "What could go wrong from Matt and me hanging out? I mean, I haven't even had my first period yet."

"You will, Court, and soon."

"I know, sis, but it seems like it's taking forever, and... " She turned to me. "Soon? How soon?"

"Sometime next week." I tapped my nose. "I could tell you were ovulating. I guess I forgot that Matt had no idea."

"My first period," she said, placing her hands over her uterus. "Soon."
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Courtney

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The next afternoon, I woke up, took a shower, and had a bag of blood, as usual. What was different, though, was what greeted me as I left my room.

I was used to either being alone down in the basement, or having Courtney hang out with me. Today, though, the whole family was waiting for me. "What's the occasion?" I asked.

"Great news," Courtney replied. "You can go upstairs now."

"I can?"

"You can," Dad said. "I had the laminate installed this morning."

I followed the family up the stairs and into the hall. Then, with no small amount of trepidation, I stepped out into the brightly lit family room.

Ever since I had become a vampire, the light of day was excruciatingly painful to me. Thanks to a special laminate on the basement windows, though, I could walk around freely down there. Now, that same laminate was on the windows on the first floor as well, freeing me to move about more of my home. "I missed this."

"And we missed you, Janelle," Mom said. "This is your home, after all, and you shouldn't be locked away from it."

I kissed all three of them, then found a comfy spot on the couch. I felt almost alive again.
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: A Pleasant Surprise

1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
As I punched in, Ham asked me into her office. "Something's been sticking with me, Red," she said. "A while back, you called in sick. Now that I know you're a vampire, I know you don't get sick. So what's the story?"

"It's a simple story, really," I replied. "There was a Van Helsing in Manhattan. And, if you recognize the name, you know what that could mean for someone like me. Since then, our side has worked things out with him, so I probably won't have to ask for another unscheduled night off."

"Good to know, Red. Now, get out there, you're burning moonlight."

******************************


At Nouri's, the cabbies decided to trade stories, and I shared my story of how I took care of the guy who robbed me. I was halfway through when the door slammed open and the guy who walked in gave a short howl and started sniffing the air. If I had doubted my senses, this behavior would have confirmed that this guy was a werewolf. Most people would have thought he was a pro wrestler, what with his tall, muscular build.

"I heard this was a good place to find some cab drivers," he said. "Glad to see I wasn't misinformed."

"So why you need ride?" Kaptan asked.

"What I need is information, Babu," the stranger replied.

"What you need are manners," Greene said. "Apologize to my friend."

"Nobody asked you. Keep your nose out of other people's business, while you still have one leg."

"Watch it, buddy," I said. "If you'll tear yourself away from yourself, you'll notice the glyph on my friend's neck. That's right, he works for the master vampire of New York City, and you just threatened to harm him."

That made an impression on him. "Sorry, gentlemen," he said. "This guy's been leading me on a chase, and it's getting on my nerves. If I can get him in the next couple of days, I'll be extremely grateful."

"What did he do?" Blasko asked. "Mistreat your sister?"

The werewolf pulled up a wanted poster on his tablet. "He's wanted for more than that. His name's Dennis Dugan, and he skipped out on his bail. He's been able to dodge me for a while, and I'm getting tired of it. If any of you see him, let me know. It's worth $500 to me. I can't very well tell people 'Kenn Lowell will sniff you out' if somebody manages to escape me, can I?"

Kaptan smiled. "That was not so hard, was it? We will look for this Dugan, and we will tell other drivers. Your apology is accepted."
1111111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Back at Work

111111111111111111112.content:
The following night, I received a phone call from a number I did not recognize. Out of curiosity, I answered... "Hello..."

"Janelle Lee?" Flatly, a deep male voice inquired.

After a pause, I replied, "This is she."

"My name is Mike Sutherland, I am a thrall to Finola." Politely, the man said. "I have been instructed to offer you an apprenticeship in the fine art of detective work."

"Finola wants me to be a detective?" Uncertain, I asked.

"It is one of the many occupations available to you." Serious, Mike replied. "I can assure you that you will get other phone calls with offers for employment tonight... consider carefully. Contact Finola when you have made a decision."

With that, the line went dead. I sighed, placing the receiver down, then jumped as it rang again. I answered after the second ring. "This is Janelle Lee." Softly, I said.

"I am known as Alucard." Darkly, a male voice said. "I hear you are seeking employment for the... graveyard shift." The man gave a creepy chuckle. "I have a few positions open in the private sector of my business. If you are interested, just call out my name,... Alucard."

With that, the line again went dead. "There is all kinds of 'hell no' about him." disturbed, I muttered. "I should ask Finola about him."

Again, the telephone rang, and I answered more cautiously. "Talk to me..."

Who was it...?
111111111111111111112.title: Dark offers of employment.

11112.content:
Everyone had gone to bed early that night but, no surprise, I was wide awake. I felt restless and confined, I had a strong urge to get out of the house. Only I also felt it would not be wise or safe to do so.

That was when my cellphone rang. Feeling the need to talk to someone, anyone, I answered, but quickly regretted it. "I am pleased to hear your voice, Janelle Lee." Flatly, a male voice said. It was Micah.

"You..." Angry, I hissed. "You did this to me!"

"You came to the rave, uninvited, under your own free will." Bemusement in his voice, Micah said. "No one forced you to accept the drink, and no one forced you to drink it. You were already dead when we started to feed, your mind had simply not accepted it yet."

"What do you want?" Ice in my voice, I demanded.

"I called to see if you were dead or undead." Simply, Micah replied. "As an undead, you need to understand a few things. First, we are both predator and prey. Those who know of us hunt us so the less people know of you, the better."

"Why did you do this to me?" Tearing up, I asked. "Why me?"

"Why not?" Flatly, Micah countered. "I could have simply allowed you to figure it all out on your own and I still can. For your sake, I suggest you listen."

I sighed though I had a thousand questions. "I'm listening..."

"You will either become a vampire like myself or a 'half-dead' which is basically vampire/human hybrid." Serious, Micah explained. "Either way, only blood will stay down. Animal blood will do in a pinch, but you will find the taste most unsatisfactory. That, and it will not sustain you quite as long as human blood."

"Why does the sun hurt?" Wincing, I asked.

"Being undead, you no longer have any resistance to UV radiation, you will sunburn and then burn rather quickly. Indirect sunlight will not harm you, but you will still need to be cautious."

"What of my family... ?" Gulping, I asked.

"It is against our code to feed upon immediate family." Serious, Micah replied. "It creates unnecessary rifts within our ranks." He gave a cold chuckle. "However, you must be among our ranks to earn that protection."

I felt my blood begin to boil, which was surprising since I was supposed to be of the undead. Then, I spoke in a tone deeper than I ever thought I could achieve. "Touch my family and I will hunt you all..."

There was a long pause before Micah replied, "Your will and nerve are far stronger than I had anticipated, interesting...."

With that, he ended the call.
11112.title: A disturbing call.

111122.content:
Later that night, Dad knocked on my bedroom door. "Can I come in, honey?" Calmly, he asked.

"It's open." Still shaken, I called.

Dad walked in and sat down next to the door. I was not certain if it was out of fear or respect, but I decided not to dwell upon it. "I did some digging." Calmly, Dad said. "All of the clues I picked up from your tale after waking point to it... you are a dhampir."

"What is a... dhampir?" Wincing, I asked.

"A human/vampire hybrid." Serious, Dad said.

"How- how is that possible?" Worried, I asked. "Micah told me that was a half-dead."

Dad sighed. "Because I am a dhampir." Darkly, he explained. "My mother was turned when she was six months pregnant with me. I do have a need for blood, just like you, but not half as much as full blood vampires, if you will excuse the expression."

"Where do you get your blood from?" Now frightened, I asked. "I never saw you drink out of a blood bag."

"That's because I only need blood once a night, being a dhampir." Serious, Dad replied. "I would need more if I am forced to exert myself, hence, I am very careful. I get my supply from a special group via package delivery."

"What group?" Worried, I asked.

"You might call them a clean up crew." Cryptically, Dad replied. "They work to ensure the secrecy of vampire existence."

"Does Mom know you are a dhampir?" Wincing, I demanded.

Again, Dad sighed. "No,... she doesn't." Almost sadly, he replied. "When you and Courtney were born, I thought I had managed to dodge a bullet. That I could live a normal life." He teared up. "I'm sorry you got caught up in this nightmare... The clean up crew will be here in an hour to talk to you."

"Wait... I have so many questions..." Tearing up, I said.

"Then ask them, little one." Calmly, a melodious voice said. "We are here to help you."

I looked past Dad to find three figures entering my bedroom. Two tall and forbidding looking gentlemen, and a a tall and slender woman with red hair, all in black business suits and jackets. The woman greeted me with a smile, showing off two long, pointed fangs...
111122.title: Dad's dark secret.

1111221.content:
"First and foremost, I am Finola." Calmly, the woman said. "I am the head of the clean up crew. This is Llewellyn to my right, and Blackwell to my left." The two men silently nodded as they were introduced to me. "We would like to hear about your night with Micah."

Sighing, I retold the story. Finola listened patiently as I explained everything in detail up to the point I woke up in the morgue. "I had not bitten anyone..." Tearing up at the end, I said. "i just couldn't get myself to... kill someone."

Finola gave me an almost kind smile though her face remained serious. "Dr. Kinski is one of my thralls, she works for me." Calmly, she said. "It was through her that we learned that you had been turned by at least four vampires."

"One of them called himself Micah." Tearfully, I said. "He seemed to be the leader at the rave."

"Were you invited?" Raising an eyebrow, Finola asked.

I shook my head. "I was drawn to the music." Now crying, I said. "It was so... haunting, yet inviting, I could not stop myself..."

Finola grunted, giving a nod. "The music you heard called to the vampire in you." Serious, she explained. "If you were just an ordinary human, you would have not heard it at all." She sighed. "As for Micah, he will be hearing from us very soon. It was partially due to him that another dhampir was awakened."

"I had no idea it would happen this way..." Sadly, Dad said.

Finola frowned. "If only some fair colleen had told you the night after you professed your love that it was destined to fail, that your children would be marked, and that they would be forced to shoulder the burden you cast aside." Darkly, she said. "Wait a tick, that was me! I said all that, every word!"

"There is no going back, once you become a dhampir, Janelle Lee." Serious, Blackwell said. "Try to understand that it is likely only a matter of time before your sister will become one as well, despite your father's careful precautions."

"What will happen to Dad?" Worried, I asked.

"He will be held accountable, but his punishment is of his own creation." Patiently, Finola said. "He must teach you and, if necessary, Courtney the way of the dhampir."

"He must also consider confessing to his wife." Darkly, Llewellyn said. "Many pure-blood vampires consider dhampir to be a subspecies. Thus, she will become a target, if word were to get out that she had married one, let alone spawned two more."

Dad seemed dead to the world at that point, not responding to anything, but Finola was not giving him any pity or mercy. "You knew the risks when you decided to deny and cast out who and what you were, for the woman you fell in love with." Serious, she said. "Now, you must face the consequences of that decision."

"What of me..." Sadly, I asked.

Finola sat down on the bed next to me. "You mentioned that you had a lot of questions." Patiently, she said. "Let's go over them, one at a time."
1111221.title: The clean up crew.

11112211.content:
I took a breath, collecting my thoughts. "First, what exactly is a dhampir?"

"Dhampirs are creatures that are the result of a union between a vampire and a human." Serious, Finola explained. "This is usually only between male vampires and female humans. I have heard stories of female vampires mating with male humans but they are very rare."

I winced, thinking of Brad. "I have a boyfriend named Brad."

Finola nodded. "We know." Calmly, she said. "First, neither female dhampirs or vampires will ever carry children, as their need for blood to sustain them will literally starve any child that may be conceived within them." She placed a reassuring hand onto my shoulder. "Only one in a billion actually survive long enough to be born, they are the true blood vampires."

I gulped at that. "And second... ?"

"Second, there is always the off chance that the passion of intercourse will lead you into draining your lover dry." Serious, Finola replied. "This is why female vampires are often referred to as 'black widows'.

I sighed, uncertain if I should continue seeing Brad, or even letting him and my friends know I am still alive. Then, I asked, "Am I immortal?"

"You have what is called Nigh-Immortality." Calmly, Finola said. "Dhampirs do not age at the same pace humans do, but they are immune to disease. Still, they are not true immortals, and they can be killed much more easily than a true vampire."

"How long will I live, then?" worried, I asked.

"There are two answers to that question." Serious, Finola said. "If you remain a dhampir all your life, you will live up to about four hundred years. If you are completely turned, you will become immortal with the normal weaknesses of a true vampire."

"What do you mean?" Wincing, I asked.

"Unlike vampires, dhampirs are less affected, but not immune to the sun." Patiently, Finola said. "They are allergic to silver, but holy implements..." She smiled. "Those are mere folklore, stories to make children feel more secure in the presence of the church."

"You mentioned if I were fully turned..." Wincing, I said.

Finola nodded. "You can become a full true vampire if you give in to bloodlust." Serious, she replied. "This is the goal of certain vampires who discover a dhampir, to convince them to embrace the dark gift." She raised a finger of warning. "If you wish to hang on to what little humanity you have left, do not fall to bloodlust."

"I have met humans who are monsters." Sadly, I countered. "Humanity is a relative term."

Blackwell smiled. "Well put, child."

Just then, Courtney entered my bedroom and froze, seeing three strangers, with me and Dad looking pale and sick. "Um... did I come in at a bad time?"

"No, dear child." Patiently, Finola said. "You are just in time." She briefly introduced herself and her colleagues. "I was explaining to Janelle what is like to be a dhampir... that is what you are as well. Does this frighten you, child?"

Courtney shook her head. "Not really." Honestly, she said. "I read all about vampires in many, many novels. I even wrote a poem about them."

She handed Finola a piece of paper. Upon reading it, a hint of a smile touched the corners of her mouth. Llewellyn and Blackwell also gave hints of a bemused smile upon reading the poem as well.

The vampire looked down on the city below.
He was once like them, fearful, but did not know.
Most of his kind do not kill those whom they choose to feed.
They give a cure to what ails them for the blood they need.
He was near dead when the vampire gave him the dark gift.
Revealing they are dark guardians gave him a lift.
Vampires stand guard when the skies turn black.
When things go bump in the night, they are the ones who bump back.


"Your innocent arrogance is refreshing, child." Bemused, she said. "May I assume you read all about vampires in romance novels?"

Courtney seemed confused by the question. "Yes, why...?"

Finola shook her head. "Forget everything you think you know, child." Softly, she warned. "There is a dangerous difference between fantasy and reality."
11112211.title: Learning about the dhampir.

111122111.content:
Courtney seemed confused. "So vampires are not guardians...?"

"Not in the sense your romance novels dictate, no." Patiently, Finola replied. "We are both predator and prey. We are not demons, but we are not angels, either."

"You might call it Limbo." Serious, Llewellyn explained. "We are neither dead nor alive. Humans require the flesh of animals and plants to sustain themselves, we require the blood of humans and animals to survive."

"Dhampirs stand in the doorway of life and limbo." Calmly, Blackwell added. "Only there is no way to become human again."

"Are there other monsters, too?" Curious, Courtney asked.

"That can only be answered through experience, colleen." Serious, Finola replied. "We neither confirm nor deny the existence of other creatures of the night."

"All creatures have their own methods of maintaining their secrecy." Serious, Blackwell said. "It is best if we do not utter their names..."

Courtney and I nodded, understanding the unspoken warning. "Is there any way to know when my sister will become a dhampir?" Changing the subject, I asked.

"It would require a catalyst." Calmly, Finola replied. "For you, it was accepting the hand of a vampire, and accepting his token of trust."

"The drink..." Gasping, I said.

Finola nodded. "Alcohol laced with his own blood."

"Right now, your sister is a sleeping dhampir, one that has not yet awakened." Calmly, Blackwell said. "With luck, it will stay that way. If not..."

"She will join me..." sighing, I said.

"We have a number of jobs you can take as a dhampir, which will earn you enough money to sustain yourself and work your way up into vampire society." Serious, Finola said. "However, you must be careful. Just like human society, there are those who will look down upon you for being... different."
111122111.title: Courtney asks some questions.

choices: I asked to see other jobs first.
1111221112.content:
Finola then turned to the door. "You may enter now."

I turned to find a tall, muscular man with short, jet-black hair enter the room. Courtney turned to him, surprised. "I did not see you come in..."

"This is Mike Sutherland." Calmly, Finola explained. "He is one of my many thralls, or servants. Mike is among the best private investigators in the area, and has a nose for finding our kind."

"It's my job to do their investigative work during the day." Serious, Mike said. "I read your college resume, you have an interest in becoming a police detective."

"I can't work during the day." Wincing, I said. "The sun burns my skin."

"I will be training you at night." Serious, Mike replied. "I believe you have what it takes to make a fine member of the clean up crew."

I turned to Finola, confused. "I'm no match for a vampire,... am I?"

"Not an experienced vampire, no." Calmly, Finola replied. "However, you are more than a match for the young, cocky new vampires who think they are the rulers of the world."

"It is these new vampires, like Micah, who threaten the Masquerade... the impression that vampires are nothing more than a myth or legend." Serious, Mike added. "If you are interested, just step forward, and your training will begin at sunset."

"Mike is one of the few thralls I fully trust." Serious, Finola said. "He has no interest in the dark gift,... yet, but he has proven his loyalty many times."

"So am I to become a thrall too?" Wincing, I asked.

"Only humans become thralls." Calmly, Blackwell said. "You would become an apprentice."

I sighed, uncertain of what to do. Yes, I wanted to become a police detective, but I never imagined becoming one to protect vampires. Finally, I made my decision...
1111221112.title: Finola offers to train me.

11112211121.content:
I sighed. "Well, I did always want to be a police officer..." Honestly, I said. "Where do I start?"

"We start by establishing your identity." Serious, Mike replied. "This means allowing your friends and boyfriend to know of your existence." He gave me an assuring smile. "It is only a matter of time before you run into them."

"But what do I tell them?" Wincing, I asked. "Hey, sorry I haven't called, but I've turned into a dhampir and I'll be chasing rogue vampires."

Finola smiled, a bemused look on her face as Mike groaned. "You tell them that you had developed a severe case of photo-sensitivity." Serious, he explained. "You had been recovering all of this time, and have just now been given the all clear to see your friends, but only at night."

"You might want to also give them the heads-up that you have taken a night class apprenticeship with Detective Mike Sutherland to learn the trade." Calmly, Finola said. "Mike will be calling you at any time during the night to help him with a case."

"Your training begins tomorrow, so I can get a full night into you." Serious, Mike said. "Do not expect me to go easy on you, there is a lot you need to learn and no time for playing around."

Though slightly insulted, I nodded silently, to which Finola rose to her feet. "It is settled then." Calmly, she said. "Call your friends before retiring for the day, and you will be able to meet with them while Mike takes you though your orientation."

"You want them to know..." Wincing, I asked.

Finola did not answer. She left my house, with Mike following.
11112211121.title: I accepted Finola's offer.

111122111211.content:
The first person I thought of was my boyfriend, Brad Butler, but he was not the first person I called. I instead called Mindy Kier, who answered on the third ring. "Hello..."

"Hey, Mindy." Nervous, I said. "It's good to hear your voice again."

"Janelle?!" surprised, Mindy asked. "Oh my goodness! I heard that you had died!"

"For a while, I thought that I had." Sadly, I replied. "I had suddenly developed an extreme case of photosensitivity. I was a mess for quite a while."

"Polymorphic light eruption?" Worried, Mindy asked. "I heard that people can develop it, but so suddenly... how bad is it?"

"I can only go out at night." Softly, I said. "Prolonged exposure to the sun would be lethal to me. I sunburned in less than a minute..."

"You poor thing!" Worried, Mindy said. "Have you called anyone else, like Brad?"

"Mindy,... I'm scared." Tearing up, I said. "Had Brad moved on or..."

"Brad has not dated anyone else since that night you were rushed to the hospital." Serious, Mindy said. "Do you want me to call him for you?"

"No,... I'll call him, but can you call Zooey and let her know I'm okay... for the most part."

"Will do." Tearfully, Mindy said. "I'm so glad you are still alive."

"If you can call what I have alive." Whispering, I muttered.

"Janelle Lee, I heard that." Scolding, Mindy said. "Having to become a night owl due to your condition does not mean you have no life."

"You're right." Sighing, I said. "Can you and Zooey come visit me tomorrow night? There are a few things I will need to tell you in person."

"We'll be there." Serious, Mindy said. "Call Brad."

"I will..."

With that, we ended the call and I then phoned Brad who answered on the second ring. "What's up, Courtney?" Sighing, he asked.

"Hey, Brad... I see Courtney couldn't get herself to tell you."

"Janelle?!" Stunned, Brad demanded. "I thought you were..."

"I had developed a sudden and severe case of polymorphic light eruption or an allergy to sunlight." Sadly, I said. "I was a mess... I felt like I had died."

"Where are you now?" Anxious, Brad demanded. "I'll come to you!"

"I'm home in my new bedroom in the basement." Tearing up, I replied. "Brad... I'm scared... I need you."

"I'm already there." Firmly, Brad said.

Like a scene in a movie, I heard the rev and screeching brakes of Brad's car as he came to a halt in front of our house. I tiredly opened the door to my room just as an urgent knock came to our door. "It's Brad." Calling up, I said. "I called him."

No answer came. "Dad?... Mom?... Courtney...?"

The firm, urgent knock came again and i ran up the stairs to find Mom, Dad, and Courtney on the floor, unconscious, with that vampire from the rave, Micah, standing over them. "They're just sleeping." softly, he hissed. "I'm only interested in you."

"I'm not." Angry, I hissed. "Brad!"

Micah chuckled. "Do you seriously think your boyfriend is going to be much help?" Amused, he asked. "I'll just drain him dry like I should have done to you!"

Just then, the front door was broken open at the hinges and in charged...
111122111211.title: Calling my friends.

1111221112112.content:
Just then, the front door was broken open at the hinges, and in charged Finola, who grabbed Micah by the throat and easily lifted him off the ground. "If you wish to keep your head, I suggest you never come here again." Hissing, she said. "There is far more to this girl than you realize, and I will not have you disrupt the Masquerade."

With that, she dropped Micah, who began to cough before quickly leaving. Once he was gone, Mom, Dad, and Courtney vanished. Only Finola seemed unfazed. "What...?!"

"A mental illusion." Calmly, Finola explained. "Experienced or talented vampires have the ability to make their victims see what is not there, a type of hypnotism." She smiled. "Fear not, your family is asleep upstairs, unaware of this."

I sighed, relieved. "For a moment, I thought I was going to have to fight him."

"That would have been unfortunate for him." Serious, Finola said. "Your boyfriend, Brad, is a Lycan thrall."

"A... what...?" Confused, I asked.

"A Lycan thrall is a human who has allied himself with a werewolf pack." Calmly, Finola explained. "He provides land, shelter, or some other service, in exchange for the pack's protection. However, this is a double-edged sword."

"What do you mean?" Worried, I asked.

"If the pack begins to see Brad as one of their own, they may induct him." Darkly, Finola replied. "However, they will not harm him, so long as he remains loyal to the werewolf pack." She sighed, placing a light hand onto my shoulder. "I advise caution, colleen. Brad is a good human, but he may not be human much longer."

With that, she quietly left, leaving the destroyed door on the floor as Brad ran in and embraced me. "The police told me that there was a burglar break-in." Worried, he said. "Were you hurt?"

"Just scared." Shaking, I said. "Brad,... we need to talk."
1111221112112.title: Finola.

11112211121121.content:
As I led Brad down into the basement, I saw Blackwell enter to repair the door. He was surprisingly fast and silent. I had to admit, I was impressed. Blackwell was gone, quietly closing the door behind him, as I closed the door to the basement. "Is this where you live now, Janelle?" Worried, Brad asked.

"This is where I sleep during the day." Serious, I replied. "You see, after graduation, I went out to celebrate my newfound freedom, and stumbled upon a rave..."

I told Brad how I had been attacked by four vampires and left for dead, only to become a dhampir like my father. Brad listened carefully, giving an occasional grunt here and there until I had finished. He sighed before turning to the window. For a moment, I thought he was going to walk out on me, only he surprised me with a deep, passionate kiss.

"Shortly after graduation, my grandfather and father led me out to our hundred acre forest summer home where I met a pack of werewolves." Ruefully, he explained. "It seems my entire bloodline are Lycan thralls."

"Finola told me you were one." wincing, I said. "She's with..."

"The vampire cleaning crew." Calmly, Brad interrupted. "Her twin sister, Aoife, leads the werewolf cleaning crew, with my father, Slade, and his partner, Cain."

"So... you know...?" surprised, I asked.

Brad shook his head. "I did not know you were a dhampir, but I did know you were attacked by rogue vampires." Serious, he said. "I thought they had killed you..."

"How did your family become Lycan thralls?" Curious, I asked.

Brad sighed. "Long story short, our ancestors took sides in the war between the two powers, and offered King Lycaon and his great pack safe hunting grounds in exchange for their protection." Calmly, he said. "These days, we help maintain the Masquerade."

"Who...?" confused, I asked.

"King Lycaon." Serious, Brad said. "The brutal ruler of ancient Arcadia, and the first werewolf." He sighed. "He is just as immortal as Dracula, but legends state that he cheats to achieve this. Werewolves live very long lives, but they are not immortal."

"Something tells me I don't want to know..." Wincing, I said.

"No one knows how he cheats death." Serious, Brad replied. "Many werewolves have obsessed over discovering the secret, but none speak of what they find..."

I sensed Brad was feeling uncomfortable so I changed the subject. "Where does all of this put us?"

Brad smiled. "Well, as long as I am dating a dhampir, I will not be inducted into the pack anytime soon." Calmly, he replied. "However, I can assure you that no rogue, vampire or otherwise, will threaten you again."

He kissed me again and, before long, we were making love on my bed.
11112211121121.title: A talk with Brad.

111122111211211.content:
Brad slept with me through the entire day, with Mom and, occasionally, Dad checking in on us, if only to ensure we were safe. When the sun went down, Brad asked if he could take me out somewhere. Of course I agreed. I had my fill of blood, then put a few bags in a cooler to go out on my first date with Brad since the night I became a dhampir.

"Be home before dusk." Serious, Dad ordered. "Don't make me come looking for you."

Brad smiled. "You sound like my dad."

Dad smiled back. "Good fathers think alike."

Brad led me to his car, a sleek black custom-built muscle car. He had built it from the ground up, with all the best parts from the best vehicles. It was one of the things I admired in him. He built what he needed, rather than settling for what was offered in the markets. "Where are you taking me?" Curious, I asked.

"To meet the family." Calmly, Brad said. "Them, and a friend who might need advice from someone who knows how it feels to be violated."

"Another victim of a rogue vampire?" Wincing, I asked.

Brad shook his head. "It's... Tasha Lyall." softly, he explained. "She was the victim of a rogue werewolf, though not directly."

"What do you mean, not directly?" Worried, I asked.

Brad sighed. "King Lycaon had ordered the death of a woman who threatened the masquerade." Darkly, he said. "Tasha was in the wrong place at the wrong time, and was attacked, only she was ready."

"Her pepper spray." softly, I said.

Brad nodded. "She survived, but, because of it, she is now a werewolf." Softly, he said. "What is troubling is that this latest order has both sides questioning King Lycaon's sanity and fitness to lead the packs."

"I see..." Worried, I said.

Brad was silent after that, driving me out of town and into the dark forest of his hundred acre property. Looking out, I found that the forest would be in near complete darkness even during the day. "I can see why people call this the midnight forest."

We drove for what seemed like an eternity before Brad stopped in front of a large cabin where a woman who looked much like Finola was waiting with two tall, muscular men. Behind them was a large number of muscular men standing in a neutral pose. "Your... pack?" Nervous, I asked.

Brad nodded. "They wanted to meet you." Calmly, he said.

He slowly stepped out of the car, with me cautiously following. "I had a feeling you would bring her here, buachaill." Flatly, the woman said.

"The pack was curious to know her, Aoife." In the same tone, Brad replied.

"Um... is everything okay?" Wincing, I asked.

"Just setting up boundaries." Calmly, Brad said. "Both cleaning crews are very wary of vampires and werewolves meeting each other."

"It is for the best that both sides avoid each other, and do not trespass upon their occupied territories." Calmly, Aoife said.

"Agreed." Nodding, Brad said. "However, Janelle was invited, and you were informed of the meeting." He smiled. "Had you disapproved, Finola would have intercepted us."

"We do not disapprove." Starting me, Finola said. "We are, as you said, wary of this meeting... anything can go wrong."

"Janelle...?" Timidly, a familiar voice asked.

I turned to find Tasha Lyall emerge from behind Aoife and her two associates. "Tasha." Nodding, I replied. "You look well..."

"You look like death warmed over." Wincing, Tasha said. "Sorry, but you smell worse."

"You get used to it." Wincing back, I said.

Tasha and I slowly approached each other, then, in a surprise move, we hugged each other, crying on each other's shoulders.
111122111211211.title: That night.

1111221112112111.content:
"When did this happen to you?" After we parted, I asked.

"The prom." Softly, Tasha replied. "Wrong place at the wrong time sort of thing. I saw a werewolf eating a woman, and got bit trying to get away from it." She blushed. "Turns out he has a crush on me... You...?"

"After graduation... I went out to dance the night away and well, stumbled upon an underground rave." Softly, I replied. "I got feasted on by four vampires, and, well, now I'm one too." I shrugged. "I'm taking an apprenticeship to learn to be a private investigator, likely for the cleaning crew."

"I'll soon be starting as a waitress and work my way up to being a chef." With a slight smile, Tasha said. She sighed as a boy I recognized as Colin Channing cleared his throat. "Janelle, this is the pack... they wanted to meet you."

The teenage boys and girls walked up to me and sniffed before giving me a slight bow and walking away. The last one to sniff me spoke. "I am Randall Woolsey." Calmly, he said. "As you are a friend to Tasha, we wanted to know your scent, so as not to confuse you for a trespasser or threat should you decide to visit her."

"Just make certain you announce your visit before coming." Serious, Aoife warned. "Werewolves can be rather impulsive when surprised."

"As can vampires..." Calmly, Randall said. "So be certain you announce your visits to Janelle in advance as well, Tasha."

Tasha and I both nodded, and I was escorted back to Brian's car. He did not speak until we were out of the forest. "It is rare for a vampire and werewolf to have a relationship." Softly, he said. "Do not be surprised or hurt if it does not last long."

"What do you mean...?" wincing, I asked. "If they wanted me away from them, why did they want to... sniff me?"

"To avoid a re-spark of the war over turned friends." Calmly, Brad replied. "Expect many vampires to try to talk you out of ever seeing her again. i have no doubt the pack is telling Tasha the same thing."

"But why...?" confused, I demanded. "I- I don't understand."

"There is a reason the two powers avoid each other." Darkly, Brad replied. "The war never really ended... they have no treaty, just a mutually beneficial cease fire."
1111221112112111.title: Talking with Tasha.

11112211121121112.content:
It was only two hours after sunset when I met up with Mike at my house. He nodded at me, then led me to his car, a modified 1933 Straight eight. "It's not exactly top of the line, but it will give any sports car a good run for its money." Serious, he explained. "I had modified it further to ward off certain attacks since joining the cleaning crew."

"Where do we start?" Curious, I asked.

"We start at the mall." Calmly, Mike said.

This surprised me. "What...? Why there?"

"Before I teach you how to be a detective for the cleaning crew, you need to know and understand how people tick." Serious, Mike replied. "You will catch on soon enough."

With that, Mike drove me to the local mall which was open late most nights. We both walked into the main hall then just stood there, watching the people walk by. At first, I did not get what any of it had to do with detective work, until Mike pointed out a young couple walking by. "Take a quick close look at that lovely couple there." Whispering, he said. "What is the first thing that strikes you as odd?"

I looked at the man and woman as they passed and whispered, "There is a strange tattoo on the side of her neck."

Mike nodded. "Good eye." Calmly, he said. "She is a thrall, a servant to a vampire. But, what you did not notice is that the man had a tan."

"He's not a vampire, but a human." Worried, I whispered.

Again, Mike nodded. "This could mean several things." Calmly, he said. "From being seduced for information, to this being his last night on Earth, at least as a human."

"Do we investigate?" Curious, I asked.

Mike shook his head. "We do not investigate anyone, human, vampire or werewolf, unless so ordered by the cleaning crew." Calmly, he replied. "Try to remember that I'm only human. I can only match another human alone."

Mike and I spent the next few hours watching people with him, pointing out subtle details that were warning signs that they were either vampires, werewolves, or humans up to no good. It was near midnight when Mike suddenly grabbed my arm and roughly pulled me behind an advertisement wall. "What..."

"Shut up!" Harshly, Mike whispered. "Don't move a muscle!"

Mike's sudden change in demeanor startled me into obeying, and I froze like a statue, with his iron grip on my shoulder. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw a tall man wearing all black, including his boots, with a long black jacket over it all. He had long, matted brown hair under a brown cowboy hat that hid much of his face. Still, I could see that it was very tan, windburned with a number of scars. As he turned my way, I caught a glimpse of his eyes. They were black, cold and calculating, reminding me of a dark pit.

After he had passed and walked deeper into the mall, Mike cautiously pulled me out from behind the advertisement wall and nudged me towards the door. "We are done here for the night, Janelle." Serious, he said. "Get back to the car as fast as you can, I will be with you in a moment."

"Who... who was that?" Wincing, I asked.

Mike answered with a glare that would have turned my blood cold it it weren't already that way, and I ran for the car. I was there almost in an instant, and felt somehow relieved once I was inside its armored interior. Mike joined me a moment later, then sped away from the mall, before grabbing a cellphone and dialing a number.

"Finola,... Victor Van Helsing is on the prowl again." Serious, he said. "Target unknown. I am taking the apprentice home."

"Negative, Sutherland." Calmly, Finola replied. "Bring her to the office. I will arrange for the rest of her family to join us."

"Care to tell me what happened?" Darkly, Mike demanded.

"Victor is the last of the clan." Gravely, Finola replied. "Someone has murdered his family... we need to solve this case, before he goes on a killing spree to avenge them."

Mike sighed. "Understood."

With that, the call ended, and Mike turned to me. "Just one rule, kid." Softly, he said. "Once inside the office, remain calm... for your own good."
11112211121121112.title: Mike starts my training.

111122111211211121.content:
"So this Van Helsing really exists..." Worried, I muttered.

"His entire clan has hunted vampires for centuries." Calmly, Mike said. "However, this one family is the last. Finola was hoping they would simply peacefully die out from old age, but this changes things."

"Any ideas who killed his family?" Wincing, I asked.

Mike shook his head. "The line starts with Dracula and goes around the block, twice." Serious, he replied. "It was only the Masquerade that was preventing them from being directly targeted."

Moments later, we arrived at a modern office complex, where Mike drove into an underground parking area before parking and stepping out. Curious, I followed him to an elevator, where Blackwell was waiting for us. "You family is resting comfortably in our guest chambers." Calmly, he said. "Please remain calm at all times. Finola prefers a stress-free environment in her dwellings."

I nodded, and Blackwell hit a twenty-digit code on a panel. The elevator took us several levels underground, to a spacious, well decorated office. There, I saw my mom, dad, and Courtney passed out on three couches. "They are merely asleep." Calmly, Finola said. "When they awake, we will explain the situation."

"Does Mom know about... us?" Worried, I asked.

Finola nodded. "She knows... she had been studying our kind since childhood and, like Mr. Sutherland, has a nose for finding us." She allowed herself a soft giggle. "It was her who proposed, knowing who and what your father was."

This surprised me, but, upon realizing what it meant, I smiled, revealing my own fangs. "That is a relief."

Finola nodded the motioned me to follow her. "The city you were born in rests upon an extensive underground cave system." Calmly, she said. "This is where we go to sleep during the day."

I looked out a window, expecting nothing and was shocked to find what could only be an underground city. "Curiouser and curiouser," Stunned, I muttered. "How deep does the rabbit hole go?"

"How deep indeed." Nodding, Finola said. "These hidden cave systems are among our most closely guarded secrets." She looked me in the eye. "I am trusting you, Janelle Lee."
111122111211211121.title: The office.

1111221112112111211.content:
Finola casually pushed a panel, hiding the window from sight. "First, understand that you are the very first dhampir to be considered for the cleaning crew." Serious, she said. "The reason for that is simple: you have a friend in the werewolf community."

"Mr. Sutherland told me that vampires would try to get me to dissolve our friendship." Wincing, I said. "That there was no treaty..."

"Both are true." Motioning to a long table, Finola said. "However, it is also true that both sides are in need of a confidant, someone on the other side they can trust." She sat at the table with me, Blackwell, Llewellyn, and Mike following. "Although you were born a dhampir, you are new to the vampire community, just as Tasha Lyall is new to the werewolf community."

"Both your parents and hers attended the same parapsychology class, taught by Finola years ago." Calmly, Blackwell said. "They, too, are friends, which greatly increases the probability of a lasting friendship between her and you, despite being on opposite sides of the coin, if you will."

"Such a strong friendship could be enough to cement an ambassadorship between the two powers, and create a better understanding, towards a real treaty of peace." Serious, Llewellyn added. "It is what both sides want."

"Only the mutual distrust holds that back, right?" Softly, I asked.

Finola nodded. "Correct. It is rare that two friends find themselves on opposite sides of this matter." She smiled. "Naturally, we would like to take advantage of that."

"As would the other side." Calmly, Mike said. "However, there is a risk."

"What do you mean?" Worried, I asked.

"A dhampir can be killed by a werewolf." Darkly, Finola replied. "That was where the legends of vampires and werewolves being equally matched came from. Thralls are equally vulnerable on both sides."

"I thought vampires were immortal." Wincing, I said.

"You have a nigh immortality." Calmly, Finola countered. "Only if you give into bloodlust and become a true vampire will you be immortal."

"For the most part, vampires are superior in both strength and speed." Serious, Mike explained. "However, werewolves in their full moon state level the playing field, and they are unaffected by the sun's rays."

"What started the conflict?" Curious, I asked.

Finola sighed. "One of Dracula's few mistakes over the centuries." Softly, she replied. "He killed a werewolf in front of her pack."

"This angered the entire pack and they attacked in force." Darkly, Llewellyn said. "Dracula was forced to fall back. Out of anger, he slaughtered the entire pack, to make them serve as an example..."

"Only it had the opposite effect." Softly, Blackwell said. "It enraged the entire werewolf community, and their revolution began."

"It was enough to pull us humans into the fray, turning it into a war of three armies." Gravely, Mike said. "It lasted for nearly a century, an era you know as the Dark Ages."

"It was not until the beginning of the Italian Renaissance that both powers agreed to a cease fire and begin the Masquerade." Serious, Finola said. "It has been an uneasy peace ever since."

"So, Janelle Lee, you can see why we need this friendship to not only last, but to strengthen, and build the foundation of a more stable peace." Calmly, Blackwell said.

"I understand." Nodding, I said.

Finola smiled. "Good girl." She then turned to the others. "Now then, what can we do about Mr. Victor Van Helsing?"
1111221112112111211.title: Office meeting.

choices: I wake up to Courtney's screams.
11112211121121112111.content:
After a thought I asked, "Why not just put him on the payroll?"

Blackwell, Llewellyn, and Mike turned to me surprised. Finola, however, cracked a bemused smile. "Explain, colleen."

"Well, the Van Helsing family had hunted vampires because they viewed them as a threat to humanity." Thoughtful, I said. "What if we could convince him to focus that anger on the rogue vampires and werewolves who threaten the Masquerade?"

"Just how would we convince him?" Curious, Mike asked. "In his eyes, we are all the enemy of his family."

"By offering to find those responsible." Simply, I replied. "Surely, you have at least one thrall keeping a close eye on him. He or she can arrange a night meeting."

Finola's smile broadened. "Keep him on a short leash by putting him on the team." Bemused, she said. "It's a novel idea..."

"Victor does develop new weapons for the government." thoughtful, Blackwell said. "Perhaps he will agree to a contract in making weapons to help us stop rogues."

"That, and he is the last one." Serious, I said. "Killing him will only make him a martyr to another family who will pick up the fight."

"I hate to admit it, but the rookie has a valid point." Calmly, Llewellyn said. "As he is the last of the Van Helsing clan, he has no doubt made arrangements to avenge his own demise, should it happen."

"I will speak with his limo driver." Serious, Finola said. "We shall meet with Mr. Van Helsing tomorrow night." She turned to me. "Well done, colleen. Now, I must insist that you get some rest. It will be dawn soon."

"I will talk to your family when they awake." Calmly, Mike said. "However, until this meeting is over, you and your family must stay here."

"I will arrange for sleeping quarters." Calmly, Finola said. "My thralls will see to your family's needs for the day."

With that said, I was escorted to an ordinary bedroom with no windows. "Sleep well, Janelle Lee." Softly, Mike said. "I will wake you at dusk."
11112211121121112111.title: The Meeting continues.

111122111211211121112.content:
I woke up just before dusk to the piercing screams of Courtney. Instinctively, I threw off the sheets and ran out to find Courtney screaming with her hands shaking and two pearl white fangs slowly growing in her mouth. "It hurts! It hurts!" Screaming, she cried.

I turned to Finola, my eyes demanding an explanation. She merely pointed to my father, who had a trembling young man off the floor by the throat on the other side of the room. "Give me one reason not to drink you dry!" Enraged, Dad roared.

"Honest mistake..." Gasping for air, the man said. "Forgive me..."

Dad grunted and literally threw the man like a rag doll across the room into one of the couches, before giving an unnatural hiss like scream. Blackwell and Llewellyn moved in and restrained him as Finola then approached Courtney who had fainted. I walked up to her, fearful, and turned to Mom, who was frozen in a state of fear. "What you have just witnessed is the first stage of bloodlust." Softly, she said. "The unrestrained rage of a dhampir."

"You mean Dad... ?" gulping, I said.

Finola shook her head. "No, he did not drain him." Calmly, she said. "Still, this man's life as a thrall is over."

"What happened to Courtney?" Wincing, I demanded.

"This thrall mistook her for an awakened dhampir, and left her real blood wine to drink." Calmly, Blackwell explained. "Being half awake, she accepted it."

"That was the first part of the catalyst." Serious, Llewellyn added. "The second was her desire to be like you."

"In the end... she got her wish." Darkly, Finola said. "Only being awake and alert for the transformation, it is excruciatingly painful." She sighed, eyeing the thrall. "When she wakes up, she will need blood."

I sighed, seeing the thrall turn white. He and I sensed that his fate had been sealed. Only Finola walked off, returning shortly with a bag of blood and a drink. She gave me the bag of blood, then handed the man the drink. "Take it." Sternly, she ordered.

Hesitantly, the man drank the drink, and soon passed out. Another thrall then dragged him away. "He will remember nothing." Softly, she said. "He will wake up with a scar where the tattoo was, and no memory of his past... a clean slate."

"It is the price of being kicked out." Darkly, Blackwell said. "An inescapable void of who you are and where you are from in a place where no one knows you."

"A fate worse than death." Whispering, I said.

Finola nodded. "This punishment is not given lightly." Serious, she said. "Only those who ruin the life of another have their lives ruined."
111122111211211121112.title: Blood Lust.

1111221112112111211121.content:
While Blackwell and Llewellyn talked dad out of his rage, I took Courtney into my arms and carried her into my chambers. I winced seeing her bleeding from every orifice and turned to Finola, who gave a solemn nod. "When a dhampir awakens, he or she bleeds almost completely dry, another reason the transformation is so painful." Serious, she explained. "Consider yourself fortunate."

Upon closing the door, I gently placed Courtney onto the bed and thrust a straw through the bag of blood, just as her eyes began to flicker open. They were blood red, just like mine were when I first awakened. She gave out a muffled scream of pain, her hands still shaking. I gripped her hand and thrust the bag of blood under her nose with my free hand. Courtney sniffed the bag then turned to me, shaking, her eyes filled with both uncertainty and desperation. "Drink it." Firmly, I said.

Shaking and in tears, Courtney took the bag of blood and took a sip. After that, she drew the blood in as if she were starved for anything liquid. Upon finishing the bag of blood, she wiped her mouth clean and turned to me as I still held her hand. "What's happening to me, sis... I'm hurting so bad..."

I felt pity for my little sister and forced a smile. "You have awakened as a dhampir." Softly, I explained. "Only the transformation is excruciatingly painful, and you were awake for it."

"That drink I found when I woke up..." Crying, Courtney said. "Did I do something wrong to be punished like this?!"

I shook my head. "No, one of Finola's servants mistook you for an awakened dhampir and left you real blood wine instead of fruit juice." Calmly, I replied. "He has paid for that mistake in spades."

"So,... what now?" Still trembling, Courtney asked. "I still have school to go to."

"Not anymore." Sadly, I said. "You will be home schooled now, with everyone being told you got the same condition of photosensitivity I have." I sighed. "Like me, you will only be able to drink blood, and will not be able to walk out in the sun."

"None of my novels prepared me for this." Shaking, Courtney said. "I am so throwing them all away when I get home."

I managed a smile. "Truth is stranger than fiction." Calmly, I said. "At least you didn't have four disgusting boys sucking on you like a meat lollipop."

Courtney gave a hiccup-like laugh before asking, "Did anything happen to Mom or Dad? Are they okay?"

I winced. "Dad went completely postal, and almost drank the one responsible dry." Softly, I replied. "Mom is terrified... bloodlust."

Courtney sighed. "Is she scared of us?"

"I think she is more scared of Dad's rage." honestly, I said. "Frankly, so am I, and I would not be surprised if it scares him too."

Courtney was silent for a moment before knotting her jaws. "Then I guess the first thing we need to do is to calm Mom down, so she can calm Dad down."

"No, the first thing you need to do is rest." Serious, I said. "I will bring you another bag of blood, and then we can talk about converting a bedroom for you in the basement."

Courtney opened her mouth to protest but I was not about to give her the chance. "You are weak right now, I don't want to see you get hurt any worse." Firmly, I barked. I pointed at her. "Stay in here."

Albeit reluctantly, Courtney nodded, and I walked out to find Dad sitting in a chair, with a furious look on his face, with Blackwell watching over him. "It would be in your best interest if you avoided eye contact." Calmly, he said. "Your father is unstable at this time, he could cross the threshold before too long."

I gulped, then turned to Finola, who was consoling Mom on the other side of the room, with Llewellyn at her side. "Are you going to turn me?" Trembling, Mom asked.

"That would be inappropriate." Serious, Finola replied. "While it is true you are aware of our existence, you are the wife of a dhampir who may soon become a true vampire. Fate will decide if you turn or not."

Mom nodded, her eyes turning dead, as she turned to me. "What am I to do, Janelle?" Crying, she asked. "I feel so lost right now."

I walked up to Mom, and knelt by her side. "You are the mother of two dhampirs, one of whom needs your strength more than ever." Softly, I said. "You are more than a mere human, I think you know that, too."

Finola raised a single eyebrow, to which Mom sighed. "It's just a family legend, it means nothing..."

"Vampires and werewolves are 'legends', Mrs. Lee." Calmly, Finola said. "What is this family legend, and why have I not heard any whispers of it?"

"Some secrets are best kept secret." Serious, Mom said. "However, now that the cat is out of the bag, I was adopted and given the maiden name of Jones, but my true maiden name is..."
1111221112112111211121.title: Courtney wakes up.

choices: Mom did not know she was a vampire.
11112211121121112111213.content:
"...Carmilla."

The second the word came out, Finola frowned deeply. "The first female vampire, and the first bride of Dracula." Flatly, she said. "Hence your fascination with parapsychology."

Mom nodded. "Also the reason why I kept it a closely guarded secret, since discovering my husband was a real dhampir."

Finola produced a needle and pricked Mom with it, drawing a small amount of blood. Strangely, Mom did not even wince as she did when a doctor gave her a shot. "What are you doing, if I may ask?" Wincing, I demanded.

"Testing her blood." Serious, Finola said. "The taste will tell all."

"The taste..." Taken aback, I asked.

"It takes years of practice to develop, colleen." Calmly, Finola said. "One moment."

She licked the blood off of the needle and smacked her lips once or twice before swallowing, and turned to Mom with a deep frown. "You are a very rare psychic vampire, my dear." Calmly, she said. "You were wise to keep this secret."

"What is a psychic vampire?" Confused, I asked.

"A psychic vampire is not actually psychic, if that is what you are thinking." Serious, Llewellyn explained. "They are vampires who feed off of a human's life energy or aura rather than blood."

Finola nodded. "They age normally, but often steal the body of a young woman, so as to live on by swapping souls." Darkly, she said. "The young woman dies of old age shortly after, and the psychic vampire lives a new life, with a new name."

This completely stunned me and I took a half step back, only Finola stopped me. "Vampires and dhampirs are immune to this, as are werewolves." Serious, she said. "Still, your mother may be far older than she lets on."
11112211121121112111213.title: continue.

111122111211211121112132.content:
"I'm a what?" Surprised, Mom demanded.

For a moment, Finola was silent. Then, she smiled... then giggled... then laughed. "You- you have no clue, do you?!" Amused, she asked. "I knew that Carmilla Karnstein had hid a daughter from Dracula at one point, ages ago, but I never suspected the girl had survived to start a new legacy..."

Mom was flattened by the news. "You mean to tell me that I'm the descendant of the queen of all vampires?!" Stunned, she asked.

Finola nodded, clearly bemused. "Is this not exciting?!" Grinning, she asked. "You had been feeding on the pent-up energy of those around you all your life, and never knew it!" She shook her head, reeling in the irony of it all. "To think you just assumed you had an allergy to the sun's rays, just like your husband, and now your children..."

"It also explains the unusual tiredness of your thralls." Calmly, Blackwell said. "Which, in turn, explains the rookie mistake made by the thrall we kicked out."

Finola sighed, shaking her head. "Has his tattoo been removed?" softly, she asked.

"Not as of yet." Calmly, Llewellyn replied.

Finola nodded. "Due to this new information, he will be given a second chance." Firmly, she said. She turned to another thrall. "Make certain he receives the antidote,... and a lecture he will not soon forget."

"Yes, my mistress." Calmly, a young man said.

He left immediately to complete his assigned task, while Finola turned back to Mom, smiling. "Your children are the far great-grandchildren of Dracula himself. You should be highly honored."

I gulped, which Finola noticed. "What is it, colleen?"

"I'm guessing Dracula would want to meet us..." Nervous, I said.

Finola nodded. "I take it you are afraid..."

"Overwhelmed is a better term." Softly, I said.

Finola smiled.
111122111211211121112132.title: Mom did not know she was a vampire.

1111221112112111211121322.content:
"He goes by the name of Mr. Ducarla these days." Calmly, Finola said. "I will inform him that his long lost grandchildren have been found, but, for now, I suggest you all take tonight to relax."

Blackwell walked away from the couch, which Dad was now sleeping on. "He is calmer now, the bloodlust has passed." Calmly, he said. "However, with each trigger, it will become harder and harder for him to curb his need for blood."

"Your family needs you, now more than ever before, colleen." Serious, Finola said. "I will have Mr. Sutherland leave you with literature to study, so you may move further into your role as a member of the cleaning crew."

I sighed. "Will they be okay?"

"Courtney will have feverish dreams for a time, as her mind comes to terms with who and what she has become, much like you were in the beginning." Calmly, Finola explained. "Your father will need time to come to terms with what he had been denying himself, and realize that he came close to gaining what he feared the most."

"Becoming a vampire...?" Wincing, I asked.

Finola shook her head. "Becoming immortal." Darkly, she replied. "Not all people relish the thought of living forever."

"And... Mom?" worried, I asked. "Why does she not look... well, dead?"

Finola smiled. "She, too, will need time to come to terms of her legacy." Calmly, she said. "As a psychic vampire, she takes the youth of others and adds it to her own, essentially keeping herself young."

"What of me...?" Worried, I asked.

"You are a friend to a werewolf." Calmly, Finola replied. "That alone puts much onto your plate of responsibilities. On top of that, you will be a member of both cleaning crews,... once trained."

I sighed. "It's going to be a long night."

"I have had worse." Calmly, Finola said. "We are off to deal with Victor Van Helsing."
