11112211121121112111213222112112.content:
My first day on the job was surprisingly pleasant. It was like revisiting my old newspaper route, and a lot of the riders were my old customers. Loretta seemed very pleased by my fares and tips. Still, I worried for Courtney and her new friend, Matt. It was not so much the fact they became fast friends... It was the fact I knew how crazy a jealous girl can get when she even suspects she has competition.

Before driving home, I stopped at an old haunt, a coffee shop called Nouri's. Upon entering, I jumped slightly as I heard a chorus of voices calling out, "Janelle!" I looked about and smiled, seeing familiar faces from my old paper route. Upon finishing my route, just after sunrise, I would always meet the same number of friendly cabbies in the coffee shop, to get myself a brew to stay awake at school.

"I saw that you had joined us cabbies." Smiling, a man wearing a turban said. "Tired of the petty tips from customers?"

I smiled at the man. He was a tall and muscular Turkish man, with a thick mustache and beard that went well with his gentle blue eyes. "Something like that, Kaptan." Calmly, I said. "That, and I missed you guys."

"We missed you too, kiddo." Kindly, another powerful man replied. "It wasn't the same around here without you." He gave me a knowing smile. "Are you still scared of the howls from the midnight forest come the full moon?"

I giggled. "I'm not a kid anymore, Greene." Ruefully, I said. "That, and I see the world in a much different way now."

Greene was a powerhouse of a man with a prosthetic leg he had lost in Operation Desert Shield, ending his military career. He had brown crew-cut hair and green eyes, but the softest smile, that always seemed to put me at ease. "So we heard..." softly, he said. "We have all learned the world is more than it seems."

I was about to ask him what he meant, but I fell silent as he showed me a thrall glyph on his neck. I turned to Kaptan and he showed me the same tattoo, before turning to the barista. "Give her the gore special."

"Um... I'm on a strict diet." Wincing, I said.

The barista chuckled. "Why do you think this coffee house is in such an isolated location, colleen?" In an Irish accent, he inquired. He handed me a steaming cup of a reddish coffee before smiling, showing a pair of fangs as he added, "On the house."

I gave a nervous smile. "Th-Thank you."

I carefully took a sip, expecting to vomit it right back up, only to find that the 'gore special' was blood with a hint of coffee for flavor. Surprised, I turned to the cabbies who nodded, smiling. "This is a vampire run coffee shop?" Surprised, I asked.

"Of course, we also serve regular customers, such as our local friendly paper girl." Kindly, a short but stocky man said. Blasko brushed his black hair aside, showing me the same tattoo, his hazel eyes watering slightly. "Finola told us the news of you becoming an awakened dhampir, the moment you were rushed to the emergency room that fateful morning."

"We cornered that cocky kid, Micah, the very next night." Serious, the barista said. "The name is Finn... Finola gave me the dark gift over ten years ago."

"So, you guys were looking out for me, even before all this happened." Tearing up, I said. I gave a grateful smile. "Thank you, Blasko,... thank you all."

Blasko waved it off with a scoff. "Bah, we all considered you one of us the moment you first walked in, wearing that ridiculous bicycle helmet, three years ago."

I blushed at that, as the cabbies chuckled.
11112211121121112111213222112112.title: Back in familiar territory.

111122111211211121112132221121123.content:
My next meeting with Tasha was arranged a few days later, in light of the incident that left my little sister and her little brother alone for a short while. Albeit against my better judgement, I took Courtney along with me. We met at the old church ruins just outside of the city, which werewolves and vampires alike considered neutral ground. Any and all fighting between the two powers was strictly forbidden in such locations. The church ruins were a monument to a citywide fire disaster decades ago.

Upon meeting Tasha there, I spotted her little brother, Matt, nervously standing at her side, just as Courtney was beside me. "I see they made you bring your sibling along too." Flatly, Tasha said. "I guess they are part of the team."

"I guess..." sighing, I replied.

Then we both said, in unison, "You won't believe what I learned about my family..."

We paused then gave a nervous giggle. "You first." Nodding, I said.

"My mom and dad are berserkers." Softly, Tasha said. "Descendants of legendary Old Norse warriors with insane speed, strength, and endurance." She paused, looking uncomfortable. "They have been offered to join the pack on more than one occasion, but will only do so if they lose control."

"That is deep." Surprised, I said. I remembered reading Mom's many books on the paranormal. "Berserkers were considered demons of war, incredibly skilled and dangerous warriors, associated with the god Odin."

Tasha nodded. "Which makes me a berserker werewolf. I have to work on controlling my temper more than ever." She sighed. "Your turn."

"I learned that my mother is a psychic vampire, as in she feeds off of life energy of people, rather than blood." Quietly, I explained. "She is also the granddaughter of Dracula... The Dracula." I gulped, feeling nervous. "I'm almost expecting Courtney and me to be offered to cross the threshold any day..."

"That makes you his great-granddaughter." Gulping, Tasha said. "That beats me..."

I shook my head, hoping to make her feel more at ease and said, "I don't know about that... I'm related to the Alpha vampire, your powers are the work of two gods."

We both paused and turned to Matt and Courtney, who had been silent all this time, to find them awkwardly smiling at each other, giving an occasional shrug or giggle rather than talking. To the casual observer, they looked like a good couple, but I sensed they did not see anything beyond friendship. "Do either of you two have anything to add to this?" Curtly, I demanded.

Matt and Courtney jumped slightly and said in unison, "We weren't doing anything..."

"That is not what she asked." Calmly, Tasha said. "Do you two have anything to add?"

"Well, he's cute... for a werewolf." Blushing, Courtney said. "I would not mind having him as a friend..."

Matt blushed. "She is pretty... for a vampire." Shuffling his feet, he countered. "Only, I already have a werewolf girl who likes me, and..."

Courtney responded with "I said friend, not boyfriend." She scoffed. "Typical boy."

Tasha and I giggled. "I don't think we have to worry about any love triangles here." Bemused, Tasha said. "Courtney seems to just like my brother as a friend."

"Agreed." Smiling, I said.

I'm glad a female werewolf had already gained interest in Tasha's little brother. Relieved, I thought. A love triangle could jeopardize the entire diplomatic effort.

Unknown to us until later, Mom and Mrs. Lyall had followed us. They were having a conversation of their own, downwind of us, until...
111122111211211121112132221121123.title: My next meeting with Tasha.

choices: After the meeting, talking to Mom.
The meeting continues with our moms.
1111221112112111211121322211211232.content:
"Do you smell that....?" Suddenly, Matt asked. He sniffed the air. "It smells like..."

Tasha sniffed the air and sighed. "Mom's perfume."

I turned and spotted Mom with Mrs Lyall, slowly standing from their crouched positions behind a nearby bush, blushing slightly. "I never could sneak up on you, Matt." Ruefully, Mrs. Lyall said. "Only I was hoping you wouldn't give us away."

"What are you doing here, Mom?!" Annoyed, Tasha demanded. "I can take care of myself, you know..."

"Your father and I were concerned for both you and Matt." Timidly, Mrs Lyall explained. "I am the better tracker of the two, so I followed, to be here in case of trouble."

"Your father was worried..." Wincing, Mom added. "I figured that, if I followed you, it would be better than him trying to put the fear of God into a young werewolf suitor."

Both Matt and Courtney winced. "Ew..."

I sighed, rolling my eyes. "Well, allow us to put both your minds at ease." Frustrated, I said. "Matt and Courtney have no intentions other than just being friends."

"Janelle and I have been friends for years." Serious, Tasha added. "We do not intend to allow some ancient feud to change that."

"That said, do you mind if we finish this meeting?" Softly, I asked.

Mom and Mrs Lyall nodded, looking rather embarrassed, and the meeting continued.
1111221112112111211121322211211232.title: We sensed their presence.

11112211121121112111213222112112321.content:
Upon returning home, I turned to Mom, annoyed. "Really, Mom?" Serious, I scolded. "What were you and Dad thinking?"

"Tasha's parents are berserkers." Surprising me, Dad replied. "Legendary Old Norse warriors who were said to be invincible to all but age."

"They are akin to werewolves, and certain legends claim they actually were just that." Softly, Mom added. "Living up to two hundred years..."

"The point is, we feared what would happen should the meeting go south." Serious, Dad said. "Vampires can keep a berserker at bay, and even kill one if necessary, but dhampirs would not stand a chance."

"Tasha is my best friend." More calmly, I said. "And her little brother already has eyes for a young female werewolf."

Dad sighed in relief. "That is a weight off my mind." Softly, he said.

"Mom, Dad, Tasha is a freak, a freak like me." Serious, I said. "Neither of us were meant to survive our encounter, but we did. Neither of us were really noticed until this happened to us. That creates a rare kinship between the two powers we all need."

"We just want to know you are safe." Wincing, Mom said.

"Then I will keep you updated on the meetings." Serious, I countered. "Just promise you won't do that again. This is going to be hard enough on both Tasha and me as it is."

Albeit reluctantly, Mom and Dad agreed. "I think it would be beneficial if we meet with Tasha's parents." Softly, Mom said. "That way, we can all be on the same page, and will not need to follow you."

I sighed. "I'll see what I can arrange."

"The carnival comes to town the day before the Fourth," changing the subject, Dad said. "Why not go tomorrow night with your friends?"

I smiled at that. "We're actually planning on it."

With that said, we all went to bed, just as the sun began to rise.
11112211121121112111213222112112321.title: A freak like me.

111122111211211121112132221121123211.content:
The carnival was held just outside of the midnight forest. It was a two-day affair that ended with the Fourth of July fireworks. Zooey, Mindy, and I attended with my little sister, Courtney, as we did every year before. Only my sister and I were finding the smell of the carnival food leaving much to be desired. We both carried our own little thermoses of 'type O' while taking in the sights and an occasional ride and game or two.

"Is that Matt Lyall?" Looking into the crowd, Mindy asked.

I turned just in time to see Matt kiss a small girl on the cheek and giggled. "Yup..."

"Fancy meeting you all here." Smiling, I said. "Enjoying the carnival?"

Tasha nodded, giggling. "We are, but not as much as Matt and Luna."

I smiled, seeing the two holding hands, then laughed as Luna threw Courtney a look of warning, pulling Matt closer to her. "Mine!" Sharply, she barked.

Courtney laughed, raising both hands. "He's all yours, kid." Bemused, she said.

"We heard you and Matt are werewolves." Quietly, Mindy said. "Does it hurt when you, well,... change?"

"Yes and no." Wincing, Tasha replied. "It hurts, but it's also a rush, like... sex."

"That's an interesting way to put it." Bemused, Susi said. "It's accurate, though."

"I have so many questions..." Wide eyed, Zooey whispered.

"As do we." wincing, Sarah said.

"You four can meet somewhere privately and discuss it later." Serious, Susi said. "Just do not share what you know."

"We've been warned." Gulping, Mindy said. Zooey, Sarah, and Elisabeth nodded.

Susi nodded, satisfied. "For now, this is a time to enjoy ourselves." Smiling, she said. "Allow yourselves to be kids for a while: it is not a role you will have forever."

We all nodded, then turned our attention back to the carnival, until we all heard a familiar howl from the midnight forest. At first, I was surprised, as the full moon was not due for another night. Then, I saw a large timber wolf at the edge of the forest, with its pack behind it.

"There is nothing to be worried about." Calmly, Susi said. "The wolf pack never leaves the safety of the forest. They howl every night before the full moon, to remind our pack it is nearly time to lock ourselves up for the night."

"That's a relief." Smiling, Mindy said.

Then, Luna ran up, looking worried and frightened. "Mommy... Matt ran off!" Tearfully, she said. "He went after the wolves!"

"What?!" Stunned, Susan demanded.

"I will handle this." Firmly, Susi said. "The rest of you stay here and enjoy the carnival."

I saw Tasha quickly grabbing her cellphone, and decided I should make a call too...
111122111211211121112132221121123211.title: The carnival.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111.content:
I called Finola, who answered on the first ring. "We are aware of the situation, colleen." Calmly, she said. "The timber wolves are not a threat."

Knowing Finola was in a meeting with my parents and Tasha's parents, I decided to keep the conversation light. "Tasha's little brother, Matt, had a sudden call of nature and ran for the trees." Calmly, I reported. "She fears he may fall into old habits."

"I understand..." After a pause, Finola said. "Meet me at the carnival in one hour, and we will see what we can do."

I heard Mom's worried voice ask, "Trouble...?"

"Just a pack of timber wolves." Calmly, Finola said. "They are not known for leaving the safety of the forest. Still, young teenagers worry easily."

I grunted at that, slightly insulted, but smiled as Mom giggled. "They will be fine."

"I will see you in an hour, then." Calmly, I said.

With that, the call ended, and I turned to see Tasha looking out at the woods, worried. "Is there anything we can do?" Curious, Zooey asked. "Maybe gather up a search party, or go looking ourselves... ?"

"I wouldn't, not so close to a full moon." Serious, I whispered. "Some werewolves, from what I read, change a night early, and stay changed until the full moon passes, so the forest is not a safe place right now."

"What can we do, then?" Wincing, Mindy asked.

"I'm going to meet with Finola in an hour to search for Matt." Firmly, I replied. "I need you two to try to help keep Tasha calm, and talk her out of doing anything rash."

"Why... isn't she a werewolf too?" Raising an eyebrow, Zooey asked.

I sighed. "She's also a berserker." To my friends' surprise, I explained. "Her parents are descendants of the legendary Old Norse invincible warriors. She'll become a real handful to all but a vampire if she, or worse, her parents freak out."

"Threatening the Masquerade..." Turning pale, Mindy whispered.

I nodded. "Exactly."
1111221112112111211121322211211232111.title: Finola.

11112211121121112111213222112112321112.content:
The night of the carnival brought very few clues, except for a small pool of Matt's blood at the bottom of a ravine. Fortunately, it was my night off work, and I was off the Fourth as well, to enjoy the fireworks. Still, I did not sleep well, worried for Tasha's little brother, and for the peace talks if anything terrible should happen to him. Courtney was equally worried for the kid. I think she had become attached to him, though not romantically.

Greene called me shortly after dusk, worried about me. "Is everything okay, kid?" Firmly but kindly, he demanded. "Nothing major, I hope?"

"Tasha Lyall's little brother, Matt, has gone missing." Worried, I replied. "He ran off to the calling of a timber wolf pack, and has not been seen since." I sighed. "He is not with them, so he could be anywhere..." I gulped. "We found a small pool of his blood."

"I'll tell the other cabbies to keep an eye out for the lad." Serious, Greene said. "We don't need his parents going full on berserk looking for him."

"You know about them...?" Wincing, I asked.

"Remember the great fire decades ago?" Darkly, Greene said. "A biker gang came into town and tried to burn everything down for being kicked out of the coffee shop... none of them were ever seen again, nor does anyone really talk about it."

I gulped, gaining a better picture of just how dangerous Tasha's parents could be, and why a non-interference pact was made with them through Finola and Aoife. "Call Finola if you happen to see him."

"Will do, kiddo." Calmly, Greene said. "We'll see you after the Fourth."

As darkness fell, Finola and I entered the midnight forest again, keeping our senses sharp for any movement or noise that would tip us off of a werewolf nearby. "Be on your guard, colleen." Serious, Finola warned. "Most werewolves lock themselves up during a full moon, but some relish the hunt."

We heard the werewolves howl from the Woolsey estate, then paused as we heard Matt howl back somewhere close. The howls came again in a chorus, with Matt howling back, coming closer. "Use extreme caution, colleen." Whispering, Finola warned. "Werewolves lose nearly all of their cognitive thinking in wolf form."

I gulped before nodding, then paused as a wolf standing on its hind legs jumped out from behind some bushes with a bark... it was Matt. Finola pushed me behind her, but paused as a small red ball rolled towards her. She looked at the ball, then turned to Matt to find him on all fours, panting with an air of excitement. He gave another bark, ran in a circle, then barked again.

"He's acting just like a wolf cub." Smiling slightly, I stated. "How cute..."

"Of course..." Smiling, Finola said. "Being raised by wolves, his first transformation made him think much like one."

With a bemused smile, she picked up the ball and gave it a light toss. Matt gave a happy bark and chased after the ball before returning it. Upon doing so, Finola handed Matt what looked like a doggy treat, which he devoured. Shortly after, he was fast asleep in a little ball at my feet. "He's actually kind of cute like this." Calmly, I said. "What do you think happened to him last night?"

"We had determined that he fell into a ravine and hit his head." Calmly, Finola replied. She motioned to the goose egg on Matt's head. "He must have wandered around, dazed, then found himself here."

I looked, then moaned. "We should have guessed..."

It was the cabin where Tasha and I had our first meeting.
11112211121121112111213222112112321112.title: The Fourth of July.

111122111211211121112132221121123211123.content:
With the issue of a missing werewolf out of the way, I slept well, and headed back to work the following night, where I resumed my role as a cab driver. My first fare, to my surprise, was detective Mike Sutherland. "Where to?" Politely, I asked.

"The warehouse district." Calmly, Mike replied. "We need to talk."

I nodded silently, then started the fare counter before pulling away from the curb. "I take it we have another problem." Softly, I said. "Anything serious?"

"We found a direct descendant of King Lycaon." Darkly, Mike replied. "This werewolf is rightfully next in line for the throne, and those currently in command will be in panic mode when it comes to light..."

"Who is this werewolf?" Curious, I asked.

Mike was silent for a moment before replying, "Matt Lyall."

I gasped hearing that. "Do you think the incident in the midnight forest was..."

Mike shook his head. "Fortunately, no." Calmly, he replied. "However, the werewolf community now knows that Matt will answer the call of the timber wolf pack."

"Which means he can be baited." Frowning, I said. "What can I do?"

"We need to be very careful from here on." Darkly, Mike said. "When we first had you and Miss Lyall start these talks, we had no idea how close you were to the prospective leaders of the two powers." He sighed. "There are those on both sides who want to see the war rekindled..."

"That makes us targets..." Frowning, I said.

"Watch out for each other, Miss Lee." Serious, Mike warned. "You and Miss Lyall are our best shot at a real peace treaty, we cannot afford to fail."

With that, we reached the warehouse district, and Mike stepped out, leaving me with much to worry about. "I need to call Tasha..."
111122111211211121112132221121123211123.title: Alpha Cub.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
Mike had tipped me $200 plus his fare before leaving me, and I went back to work. It was a rough night, to say the least. Most of my fares were young vampires, some with an unsuspecting human escort. To be fair, they were all gentlemen, but those alone had words for me regarding my talks with Tasha Lyall.

One of them was a teenage girl I had heard of from detective Mike Sutherland. Her name was Abby Vamp. She was about a year older than me, with shoulder-length red hair and deep green eyes. She wore a strange school uniform I did not recognize, with a cloak too big for her covering it. I guessed she had borrowed it from her mother. Abby was well known for stirring up trouble among normal teenage boys. She would seduce them into doing all sorts of crazy things for nothing more than her own twisted amusement. I pressed a button near the fare counter, something Abby noticed.

"There is an order for your capture, Vamp." Darkly, I said. "You have about three minutes before detective Sutherland, or worse, the cleaning crew arrive and take proper action."

"Your precious cleaning crew is busy dealing with my two new little friends, who are right now visiting your werewolf friend." Grinning, Abby countered. "Normal boys are annoying, but they are at least useful as a few minutes of distraction."

"What do you want, Vamp?" Ice in my voice, I demanded. "I doubt it's a ride..."

"I want to know if you are really willing to decline the dark gift." Grinning, Abby said. "You know there are many vampires who frown upon a dhampir being directly related to the dark lord, Dracula."

"They also frown upon the dark gift being forced." Unimpressed, I said. "The choice must be mine and mine alone."

"There are many vampires who would see the dark gift forced upon Mr and Mrs Lyall to gain a foothold in their campaign to take Lycaon's throne." Frowning, Abby said. "You need to think about what is right for your own kind."

"My own kind..." Annoyed, I asked. "What do you mean by that?"

"You are Tasha's best friend, perhaps the only friend she has." Grinning, Abby said. "She listens to you. That said, if she takes the werewolf throne, the vampire world can take back what is rightfully theirs."

"I think I know where this is going." Becoming angered, I said.

"I'm running out of time." Stepping out, Abby said. "Think about this, you know I am right. Your werewolf friend and her cub brother are the keys to making us rulers of this world again."

With that, she was gone. I found I had to count to ten to control my anger, feeling my blood beginning to boil. Fortunately, my night was almost over, and I turned my cab in early, to Ham's surprise. "Rough night?" Softly, she asked.

I nodded. "Yeah but I got my usual quota in." Softly, I replied. "I need a stiff drink..."

"What happened?" Firmly, Greene demanded. "Someone give you trouble?"

I sighed. "Abby Vamp is up to no good again." Frustrated, I said.

I went on to describe the conversation, to which Kaptan chuckled. "Good luck to her on that one." Bemused, he said. "Only an experienced vampire can take on a berserker alone, and these two have the protection of the pack."

"There is one other thing..." Wincing, I said. "Matt Lyall...."

Greene chuckled. "Matt is known to run off in the middle of the night to the call of the timber wolf pack." Bemused, he said. "He occasionally pops in at the coffee shop for a brew with his allowance."

"I didn't know that." surprised, I said. "Only I was told that..."

"Yes, he's the Alpha Cub." Nodding, Blasko said. He grinned. "Who do you think took him to the timber wolves when he was but an infant?"

"You guys...?" Surprised, I asked...

Greene nodded. "It was my first year as a thrall." Serious, he explained. "Dracula himself ordered me to take the infant to a safe place, far away from the Van Helsing family, who had decided to gun for the werewolves.

"But why...?" confused, I asked.

"To rekindle the war." Darkly, Ham replied. "Vampires were hard pressed to fight a war on two fronts, as were the werewolves..."

"They wanted to get the humans back into the fray." Horrified, I said.

"Another reason why a peace treaty is more important than ever." Softly, Kaptan said.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: Talking to the cabbies.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
Upon returning home, I filled my parents in on my night and my encounter with Abby Vamp, then gave Tasha a call. She answered on the second ring. "We have trouble, Janelle." Darkly, she said. "Two freaked-out boys tried to jump my little brother."

"Is he okay?" Worried, I asked.

"Other than being annoyed, my brother is fine, but I can't say the same for the boys." Softly, Tasha replied. "Being a true born werewolf, he mopped the floor with them."

I remembered werewolves being very strong, even in human form, but for Matt to easily take on two teenage boys on his own and win was frightening. "Did your parents get involved?" Wincing, I asked.

"That's the only reason those boys are still alive." Sighing, Tasha said. "Do you know anything about this?"

"A trouble-making vampire named Abby Vamp bewitched them into causing you and your brother grief." Serious, I explained. "It's a form of hypnotism vampires seem to have over humans."

"Why us?" Worried, Tasha asked.

"To distract the cleaning crew so she could talk to me." Frowning, I replied.

I then told her of the encounter, to which she gave a frustrated sigh. "My parents are going to be furious..." Darkly, she said. "What am I going to tell them?"

"Tell them to talk to Aoife about the incident." After a thought, I said. "She knows more about Abby's agenda than I do. Still, I would warn them to be on their guard."

"You be careful yourself." Serious, Tasha said. "We both know from history class that where there is a king, there is one or more wanting to dethrone him."

Upon ending the call, I sighed, sensing Finola appearing. "I am doing what I believe is right for the peace effort." Serious, I said. "Communication is key."

"I'm not here to berate, colleen." Calmly, Finola said. "In fact, I applaud your actions thus far. We are here to brief you on Abby Vamp."

"How serious of a threat is she?" Darkly curious, I asked.

"Abby Vamp is was granted the dark gift seventy years ago by Akasha, the self proclaimed 'queen of the damned,' whom she killed shortly after." Serious, Finola explained. "She is intelligent and manipulative, with a core hatred for werewolves, as they were seen as our servants."

"What am I to do if she approaches me again?" Worried, I asked.

"Do not engage her unless you are forced." Serious, Finola replied. "As the direct descendant of Dracula, you have strengths and powers you are yet unaware of."

"I take it you do not want those powers to surface." Frowning, I said.

"Without proper training to control them, no." Frowning back, Finola said. "It would be like allowing Tasha to unleash her berserker powers under a full moon."

I nodded. "How do we proceed from here?"

"You get some rest, then arrange your next meeting with Tasha." Calmly, Finola said. "Both of you will be bringing your boyfriends along, to begin talks between the thralls of both powers." With that, she and her escorts were gone.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: I call Tasha

choices: A night off with my boyfriend.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
I slept well that day, and woke up a few hours after dusk. Ham had given me the night off after my encounter with Abby. I immediately regretted sleeping in, hearing a commotion in the house. I quickly downed a bag of blood and rushed up the stairs to find Mom, distraught, talking to Finola. "Please find my Stephen!" Crying, she wailed. "He has not come home from his nightly stroll, and with his frustrations,..." She began to cry.

"Please calm yourself, Anita." Softly, Finola said. "We will find your husband."

"We'll all find him." Serious, I said. "We can cover more ground that way."

Finola nodded, then paused as her cellphone rang. She answered and immediately frowned. "We are on our way. Bring his family along, a little shame may give them pause to think before doing this again."

Mom sighed, giving an exasperated look. "They're doing that again?!"

Finola sighed herself. "They did this the last time we got together, 20 years ago. How is it possible that they haven't changed a bit in all this time?"

"What...?!" Worried, I demanded.

"It would be easier for you to see it for yourself, colleen." Bemused, Finola said.

With that said, we were whisked away in a cloud of darkness, to appear in an alley, where Dad and Mr Lyall were in what could only be seen as an all out brawl. Shortly after, Aoife appeared with Mrs Lyall, Tasha, and Matt, who looked at the spectacle with equal surprise. Upon seeing us, they stopped their brawl, then picked up a tall jug of a red liquid and toasted each other, laughing heartily.

Finola shook her head. "Some people never change..."

"Henry!" angered, Mrs Lyall yelled. "What on Earth are you doing?!"

"Nina....*HIC!* Join us!" In a drunken slur, Mr Lyall said. "We all need to let go here... *HIC!* and there!"

"Blood wine..." Frowning, Mom muttered. "Stephen, really?!"

Dad pouted, like a little boy who just got caught with his hands in the cookie jar. "We're celebrating, Anita... *BURP!* Don't be mad... *BURP!*"

I winced, smelling the alcohol on his breath from over six feet away. "What are you celebrating, Dad...?" Feeling embarrassed by him, I asked.

Dad smiled, revealing two very sharp fangs. "I am now a vampire... *HIC!* just like your mother... *BURP!*

"A very drunk vampire." Frowning, Finola said. "The headache and vomit fits you will have trying to sleep come dawn will make the aftermaths of your college years pale in comparison."

"The same will be true for you, Mr Lyall." Firmly, Aoife scolded.

"It will be nothing compared to when I get a hold of him." Furious, Mrs Lyall muttered.

"Likewise..." Angry, Mom said. She turned to me. "I suggest you get some ear plugs. I am about to make your father wish he never bought heavy metal records."

I could only shake my head at that.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: Dad becomes a vampire.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
I slept that day in the office guest room, where it was fortunately silent. The following night, after my evening meal of O-negative, I was greeted by Detective Mike Sutherland, who handed me a file. "You and I have been ordered to investigate a young female Omega within the werewolf pack." Serious, he said. "Normally, this would be a case for Tasha Lyall, but this Omega is a co-worker of hers."

"Which means she may already have a personal stake in the situation." Sighing, I said. I shook my head. "Who is this Omega, and why are we investigating her?"

"Her name is Crystal Canine, a Viewolf." Calmly, Mike said. "She is half werewolf and half vampire... Her mother had fallen in love with a vampire, before she was bitten."

"So Crystal was born in-between." Frowning, I said. "It had to be hard for her."

Mike nodded. "It was, but now her parents are getting divorced." Serious, Mike said. "She must decide which community to go to, and deal with being accepted or rejected."

"Wait... she can live in both communities?" Surprised, I asked.

Mike nodded. "So long as she is accepted, yes." Serious, he replied. "This will be a crucial test to the peace effort you and Tasha Lyall are working on."

"Why...?" Confused, I asked.

Mike sighed. "Her father is Aoife's great grandson." To my surprise, he said. "He wants her in the vampire community, to prove vampires are more civilized by accepting even the Omegas."

"It's political, then." Frowning, I said.

Mike nodded. "Miss Canine is more vampire than werewolf, though she does transform with the full moon." Calmly, he said. "We need to get a feel of how the vampire community views a Viewolf joining their ranks."

"Then Tasha must get a feel of how the werewolf community views her." Guessing correctly, I said. "Where do we start?"

"I will be traveling with you on the job as a cabbie." Serious, Mike replied. "if anyone asks, I'm a supervisor giving a review."

I nodded, expecting a long night.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: Training with detective Sutherland.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
As I feared, it was a long night. Mike was all business in the shotgun seat. His eyes were focused on my route, and his ears on the passengers we picked up. There was no talking between us, but he encouraged me to talk to the passengers as if he were never there, watching my every move. It was intimidating to say the least, but I found that many vampires were already talking about it.

"It's sad that woman got bit by a werewolf while she was pregnant." One woman said. "At least he is leaving her for a true vampire, but it leaves the poor girl in limbo."

"That Canine girl is more vampire than werewolf." One man said. "A good dose of bloodlust will cross her over enough to be welcomed."

"I'm glad the vampire and werewolf are getting divorced." another woman said. "It is for the best. And, as for their child, well,... she is more vampire, so she still has some potential to grow."

"The Canine girl is better off with the werewolves." Calmly, another man said. "Even an Omega can become an Alpha, and, from there, a girl with vampire blood will see our side of the conflict, and make the right decisions for both worlds."

I smiled at that last comment, as it offered a glimpse of a shared desire for peace between the two powers. Only it also showed a shared feeling of superiority over the werewolves, which was what brought on the old war in the first place.

"We have a lot of work ahead of us." Sighing, I said at the end of the night. "i don't see anyone in the vampire community rejecting Miss Canine, but I do not see anyone welcoming her with open arms, either."

"Nothing worthwhile is ever easy, Miss Lee." Calmly, Mike said. "It took time for the vampire community to accept and respect me, a mere human, as a detective for the cleaning crew."

"You told me." Nodding, I said. "How you have a knack for finding vampires, and dealing with them, if needed."

"I told you I was lucky." Softly, Mike said. "My job is to find and report rogue vampires, not to engage them, unless necessary." He turned to me. "I'm not training you as a partner, but as a replacement. Being human, I do not live forever, and don't even ask me about the dark gift... I have not yet decided."
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: a night at work.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
Upon returning home, I saw Dad sitting at the dining room table, with a look of utter misery on his face. Mom smiled upon seeing me and loudly greeted me. "Hey, honey! How was work?!"

Dad moaned, wincing, which caused me to wince. Mom merely shrugged. "He will be back to being his old self tomorrow night."

"Where is Courtney?" Looking around, I asked.

"She went to bed early." Grumbling, Dad said. "She was sick of mom's loud voice."

Mom smacked Dad on the back of the head, lightly, but it still caused him to moan. "You only have yourself to blame, Stephen." Firmly, she said. "The hangover will pass by tomorrow night."

Deciding to change the subject, I asked, "Mom, Dad, do either of you know a viewolf named Crystal Canine?"

Mom and Dad both froze, then slowly turned to me, suddenly making me feel nervous. "Why do you ask?" In a cautious tone, Mom demanded.

"Detective Mike Sutherland and I were ordered to investigate her." Wincing, I said.

Mom sighed. "I'm sure you are familiar with love triangles..." Softly, she explained. "Crystal's mother, Collie, was infatuated with a vampire, but a werewolf was in love with her."

"When it came to a fight between the two, Collie jumped between them, and got bit in the process." Sadly, Dad added. "Neither one knew she was pregnant."

"Collie married the vampire, as she saw the bite as an attack, and they tried to make it work for fifteen years, but it ultimately failed." Frowning, mom said. "They have filed for a no-fault divorce, but Crystal's future hangs in the balance."

"How do you know all of this?" Wincing, I asked.

Mom bowed her head. "Collie and I were childhood friends." Sadly, she said. "I was there when the fight broke out. Only at the time, I thought Bruno was protecting her from a large wolf attack."

"Where is the werewolf who loved her now?" Curious, I asked.

Mom sighed. "In Transylvania, the head of their cleaning crew there."

I could only shake my head. "So now it's a custody battle."

Dad nodded, a twisted smile forming upon his face. "Here is the rub, though." Softly, he said. "Everyone is assuming she is a viewolf."

"What do you mean assuming?" confused, I asked.

"Your mother and I were tied for top of the class in Parapsychology." Grinning, Dad said. "There is no proof Crystal is the daughter of the vampire or the werewolf, it was just assumed. A simple test will prove who her biological father is without question."

Mom sighed. "The sun test."

Dad nodded. "It is likely that Crystal was sheltered from the sun since birth."

"Only I saw two fangs when she was angry... " Confused, I said.

"All werewolves show fangs when they are angry." Calmly, Mom said.

I sighed. "I think I better bring this new information to Finola's attention."
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: Returning home.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
I called Finola minutes later and quickly relayed what I had gathered from mom and dad as well as my report from my cabbie job. Finola was silent until I had finished, asking, "What are your orders, ma'am?"

"I will have Aoife contact Tasha and and see if the sun test can be arranged." Softly, she said. "If it is confirmed that Crystal is indeed all werewolf, it will destroy Bruno's chances of gaining custody of her." She sighed. "However, it will also embarrass the pack who had assumed from the beginning she was the offspring of a vampire."

"Why was this test not done earlier?" Curious, I asked.

Finola sighed. "Because, colleen, it is still considered taboo for a werewolf to mate with a vampire, regardless of the circumstances.."

"But werewolf venom does not affect a vampire, or the other way around, taboo or not." Firmly, I countered. "This is looking like a clear case of discrimination... from both sides."

Finola paused before letting out a low chuckle. "Well done, Janelle." Calmly, she said. "You are right, Crystal is all werewolf and both sides know this. Only, because her mother chose to marry a vampire, they branded the girl a viewolf."

"But why?" Confused, I asked. Then it hit me, and I sighed. "Viewolf is also a hate word to werewolves..."

"Precisely." Serious, Finola said. "Crystal was branded only because her mother, Collie, chose to marry a vampire. It is this level of hatred and mistrust you and Tasha Lyall are up against."

"Then the first step is to break down some of these wall of hate." Serious, i said. "Starting with Crystal Canine."

"Good day, colleen." Softly, Finola said.

She then ended the call.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: Calling Finola.

choices: I go back to the coffee house.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
The following night, Aoife arranged for me to pick up her and Tasha Lyall in my cab, for a ride and a talk. "Loveta Howl is a loose cannon." Darkly, Aoife said. "While the vampire community cannot do anything to stop her, the werewolf community can."

"Do you think she is a threat to the peace process?" Serious, Tasha asked.

Aoife sighed. "She is an obstacle, slowing the process down." Serious, Aoife replied. "She believes that her family is next in line to become Alpha."

"Only they are not." Guessing correctly, I said.

"Tasha's family is next in line, due to their son, Matt, and their status as berserker allies to the pack." Serious, Aoife said. "When she figures that out, Matt will become a target."

"Over my dead body!" Angry, Tasha growled.

"Patience, colleen." Scolding, Aoife said. "I will be having a talk with Miss Loveta Howl and her parents shortly. We need you two to continue as you were, being friends, and making more in both communities."

"Speak of the devil..." Softly, I said.

I brought the cab to a halt in front of the Gentleman Wolf restaurant, which was my next scheduled stop. I guessed that this Loveta Howl was my next fare.

"I guess she needs a ride home..." Flatly, Tasha commented.

"Follow the normal rules." Serious, Aoife said. "I will have a word with her."

I waited while Tasha and Aoife stepped out. Tasha tried to walk past Loveta, only she grabbed her arm in a threatening manner. With my vampire hearing, I could hear her say to Tasha, "You and I are going to have a talk..."

"You are hurting me, Loveta..." Growling, Tasha warned.

I sighed, hearing the animalistic growl in Tasha's voice. She is asking for it. Shaking my head, I thought.

"You and I are going to have a talk, colleen." Firmly, Aoife said to Loveta. "There is a short verse, written a long, long time ago about a class of humans who vampires and werewolves alike have learned to give a wide berth, to avoid... complications."

She motioned to Tasha then recited the verse....

They were many times outnumbered, still they fought on.
Blood from their wounds seeped into the Earth, still they fought on.
Vultures waited for them to die, still they fought on.
Odin alone chose this day to bestow upon them the berserker rage.
Now men and women, fueled by Gods, rose from the ground, screaming like bloodthirsty animals.
Thus is is the gift of absolute mortal power.
No blade or weapon could harm them.
They killed man and beast alike.
All who stood in their way died that night.
When it was done, they decreed, Hail the Gods of War...


"A biker gang learned this the hard way." Serious, Aoife added. "I suggest you think long and hard before provoking that kind of rage..." She then turned to me. "Patience is all that stands between you and the animal within."

With that, she stepped back into the cab. "The office."

I nodded, and drove away from the restaurant. "What was that all about, ma'am?" Curious, I asked. "A warning to Loveta?"

"A reminder of who she is slowly pissing off." Darkly, Aoife replied. "A similar reminder will be given to Abby Vamp."

"Wait... what?" confused, I asked.

"Nothing you need to worry about for now." Grinning, Aoife said. "Just focus on your mission and career." She paused as I brought the cab to a halt in front of the office, and handed me a $1000 payment. "This should fill your quota for the night,... tell Ham I said you deserve a break."

With that, she slipped out of the cab, and was gone.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: A talk with Tasha.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
Feeling the need to unwind, I went back to Nouri's. I got the usual greeting, a chorus of voices calling out, "Janelle!"

"Hey, guys." smiling, I sighed.

"Rough night?" Calmly, Greene asked.

"I found that Tasha has a new rival, named Loveta Howl, who is beginning to get on her berserker side." Taking a seat, I said. "Aoife gave her a friendly warning... a short verse, written a long, long time ago, about a certain class of humans."

Kaptan nodded. "Although berserkers are no match for a vampire in a lengthy fight, they can make a vampire regret engaging them." Serious, he said. "They do not stop coming until either they or the vampire is dead."

"Relentless is the best way to describe a berserker." Serious, Blasko said. "Fortunately, they do not live in large numbers, like in the old days. They tend to isolate themselves until a war comes to their doorstep."

"Hence the greater need for peace." Softly, I said.

Greene nodded. "Exactly." Calmly, he said. "What do you know of this Loveta Howl?"

"From what I understand, she is a spoiled brat, and the daughter of the Beta wolf." Frowning, I replied. "I have a feeling she is hungry for power over the pack."

"Which makes young Tasha Lyall an obstacle, as her parents will become the new Alphas, should they ever go completely berserk." Calmly, Kaptan said. He gave a bemused smile. "I have a feeling her tactics will only serve to sabotage her goal."

"I'm more worried she may try to sabotage the peace effort." Serious, I said. "From what I have observed, Mr and Mrs Lyall are loyal to the pack, but they are obsessively fascinated by vampires."

Greene chuckled. "They are a curious lot." Bemused, he said. "Finola and Aoife have learned that, by enticing their curiosity, they can keep them relatively calm."

"Any other news?" Smiling, Kaptan asked.

"Aoife told me that she would be giving Abby Vamp a similar warning about me." Worried, I said. "I have no idea what she meant by that... she told me it was nothing to worry about, but I can't help wonder."

Greene sighed. "Simply put, you were kept in the dark about your vampire heritage for a reason." Softly, he said. "Your father.... your grandfather was a Van Helsing who was willingly turned, the black sheep of the family."

"Grandpa was turned... why?" Taken aback, I asked.

"He felt the best way to fight vampires was to become one." Ruefully, Blasko said. "Only his gamble cost him the family name, and he changed it to Lee, to avoid persecution from his own clan."

"With your mother being a psychic vampire and granddaughter to Dracula, and your father a descendant of the Van Helsing clan, you and your sister are far more powerful than either of you might imagine." Serious, Greene said.

I gulped at that, then turned, as I heard the bells on the door chime, to find...
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: I go back to the coffee house.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
I was surprised to see Tasha's little brother, Matt step in. He had an innocent smile on his face as he pulled Tasha in with him. "Come on, they aren't going to bite you." Grinning, he said. "They have great coffee here."

"Something you should not be drinking at your age." Wincing, Tasha said.

She gave a nervous smile to those inside the coffee house as hardened expressions turned their way. Only they all softened when Matt spoke, "It's okay, this place used to be a church, so it's still holy ground."

"I can't argue with that logic." Smiling slightly, Greene said. "Welcome, Miss Lyall."

"Th- thank you." Nervous, Tasha said. "Matt told me this was where he went to relax and unwind after a long day."

"That it is." Nodding, Finn said. He turned to Matt. "Do you want the usual?"

Matt nodded. "Yes, please." He produced a number of bills then added, "One for my sister, too, there's a lot of shenanigans afoot."

"Really?" Raising an eyebrow, Kaptan inquired. "May we ask what sort?"

"Her rival and her rival are plotting something." Pointing to me and Tasha, Matt said. "Aoife has already been told and she's not happy."

"It's a given that Abby Vamp is just using Loveta." Frowning, I said.

"I agree." Frowning, Tasha replied. "Only I have a feeling Loveta believes it's the other way around." She sighed. "I wish I knew what they were up to."

"I already told you." Irritated, Matt said. "They want to know why you and Janelle are always hanging around each other and the two cleaning crews." He huffed. "It's like they're jealous or something."

"You just may have it there, kid." Softly, Finn said. "The cleaning crew is among the highest ranking officials on either side. They may be thinking Miss Lyall and Janelle are trying to rise quickly in ranks."

"With both hungry for power, they would see it as a threat to their goals." Thoughtful, Greene said. He turned to Matt. "Good detective work, kid."

Matt blushed, then beamed as a steaming cup of what looked like coffee was put in front of him. I was surprised and a bit bemused to see that it was the gore special. Matt sniffed it, then took a sip before grinning. "It's good, sis... try it!"

"Werewolves also enjoy the taste of blood." Whispering carefully, Greene explained. "Though they prefer it to come with a chunk of meat."

I gulped at that, then turned to Tasha as she took her first sip. At first, she looked as if she were going to spit it out, but then she swallowed. "I've never had... blood coffee before." softly, she said. "It's got a unique flavor."

"Do you like it?" Bemused, Finn asked.

After a pause, Tasha shrugged. "It's okay..."

Kaptan smiled. "You like it."

The cabbies then turned to normal conversations about life in general as cab drivers, and, before long, Matt and Tasha left on good terms. "They're pretty good kids." Smiling, Finn said. "There just might be hope for peace yet."
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: Matt and Tasha Lyall.

choices: I said dad would have to invite him.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
As I left Nouri's to go home, I felt a death-cold chill, as a light fog rolled in from nowhere with a forbidding darkness. It did not affect my vision, but it did seem strange. I reached my car, only to jump as a tall figure appeared from the fog. He was ghostly pale, with red eyes, and wore an old fashioned tuxedo. With him were two familiar figures, Aoife and Finola. "Good Evening, Miss Lee." Politely, the man said. "It is a pleasure to meet you at long last. I am... Dracula."

My eyes went wide, and, not knowing what to do, curtsied, much to Dracula's apparent bemusement. "It is an honor to meet you, sir." Softly, I said.

"The honor is mine." Calmly, Dracula replied. "You can relax. I have only come to you because I have heard whispers of your efforts to secure a peace between vampires and werewolves." He smiled, showing his long fangs. "I applaud your progress."

"Thank you." Blushing slightly, I said. "Only I can't take full credit..."

"Yes, of course, Miss Tasha Lyall." Calmly, Dracula said. "I would congratulate her as well, but I doubt her parents would approve of my presence in her home." He touched my shoulder, sending an unnatural chill down my spine. "I wish to speak to your mother. Would you be so kind as to invite me in...?"

I looked around and jumped, realizing that we were now in front of my house. I did not know how we got here, as we had not moved from my car, but I decided not to ponder over it just then. I turned to Aoife and Finola, who kept a neutral stance, revealing nothing. I had to decide on my own.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: A visit from Dracula.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
"My father is the man of the house." Calmly, I said. "If it is an invitation you are seeking, you will have to ask him."

Aoife and Finola smiled. Apparently, that was the right answer. I knocked on the front door and waited until Dad answered. He gave me a confused look, then sighed upon seeing Dracula with Finola and Aoife at his side. "Good Evening, Lord Dracula." Calmly, he said. "I have been expecting your visit for some time. Please, do come in..."

Dracula nodded and entered, with Aoife and Finola following. I took up the rear, and closed the door before locking it. Finola turned to me, curious. "House rules." Simply, I said. "All doors are to be locked when everyone is home."

Dracula waved it off with a move of his hand. "A sensible precaution." Calmly, he said. "We do live in interesting times."

"Indeed we do." Stepping up, Mom said. She bowed. "Welcome to our humble home, Lord Dracula."

"Your hospitality is gracious, dear granddaughter." Smiling, Dracula said. "You carry an uncanny resemblance to Carmilla Karnstein... so frail looking, yet a storm rages within your soul." He gently touched her cheek. "There is so much I want to show you... teach you..."

For a moment, I thought Dad was going to step between them, which would likely have been a terrible mistake, so I spoke up. "Don't make us jealous, Lord Dracula."

Dracula turned to me, a bemused smile forming onto his face. "Oh,... you yearn to cross the threshold?" Softly, he asked. "A brief moment of rage, a boiling of the blood, and you will live forever..."

"I wish to earn it." Softly, I replied.

Aoife and Finola smiled as Dracula's bemusement grew. "So, you serve to reach a peace in return for your immortality." Smiling, he said. "Interesting..."

"Nothing is free, there is always a price." Serious, I replied. "Obtaining peace is no different... right now, noone has an obvious advantage, so peace can be achieved, at little cost, while this dhampir is friends with a berserker werewolf."

Dracula chuckled. "Well said, granddaughter." Calmly, he said. "When you are ready, I will show you your legacy."

After talking with Mom and Courtney for a short time, Dracula made his leave. Finola was the last to leave, with me showing her out. "You did well tonight, colleen." Kindly, she said. "You gave all the right answers, Dracula was impressed with you."

With that, she left.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: All the right answers.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
I was awakened with a telephone call from Finola just after sunset, which I answered on the second ring. "Good evening," Flatly, I said.

"I know it is your night off, Janelle, but we have work." Firmly, Finola said. "We may have a mole in our midst."

I sat up, now fully awake. "A mole? How? When?"

"All good questions, but no answers yet." Serious, Finola said. "The meeting between Loveta Howl and Abby Vamp was arranged by a servant of Van Helsing, who used them both to sow a new wave of distrust between the powers with a fake vampire arrow... his calling card." She paused, then added, "Tasha was attacked by Loveta Howl during the last full moon."

"Will she be okay?" worried, I asked.

"Loveta failed to heed my warning, and a berserker werewolf was born." Darkly, Finola said. "Tasha could have killed her, but she instead made her a new ally."

"If the meeting was arranged by a servant of Van Helsing, he or she may still be hiding within the pack." Startled, I said.

"Which suggests we may have the same problem." Serious, Finola said. "Work with Tasha and Detective Sutherland,... find those moles."

"What do you want done, should we find our mole?" Frowning, I asked.

"Leave that detail to me." Darkly, Finola replied. "Mike will pick you up in five."

With that, Finola ended the call, and I began to wonder who to question first.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: Back to work.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
Not long after, the phone rang. I saw on the caller ID that it was Tasha, and I answered on the third ring. "Finola has already called and briefed me on the matter." Calmly, I said. "There may very well be a mole among the vampires as well. She wants us to work together in flushing them out."

"Susi is spearheading the search among the pack with the Beta couple." Serious, Tasha said. "Would you like me to join you in questioning Abby Vamp or the vampire thralls?"

I winced at that suggestion. "It's a vampire affair." Remaining calm, I said.

"It's a joint concern, as the Van Helsing family has invaded both powers for the sole reason of sowing distrust." Calmly, Tasha countered. "I will follow your lead, as it will be in vampire territory." She then added, "After all, I am a berserker, which means I fall under the non-interference treaty. I do not attack unless attacked."

After a pause to think about it, I let out a slight giggle. "I'll pick you up in ten."

After ending the call, I took in a meal of blood and informed my parents of the situation. After I gave them the details, Dad sighed. "Be careful, honey." Serious, he said. "This mole will not be taken alive, knowing the fate that awaits him or her when caught."

"What do you mean?" Taken aback, I asked.

"Drained dry, if caught by a vampire; eaten alive, if caught by a werewolf." Gravely, Mom replied. "It is barbaric, I know, but it is the way of the two powers."

I shuddered at that.

A few minutes later, Detective Mike Sutherland picked me up and drove us to the Gentleman Wolf restaurant to pick up Tasha, to begin our mission to find the mole.
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: continue.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
After Mike made a brief private phone call, finding Abby was not a challenge. It was as if he were part werewolf, though I was assured by Finola it was neither. Abby was standing outside of a small cemetery when we caught up with her. "We need to talk, Abby D'Arcy." Flatly, Mike said. "It would be wise of you not to run."

Abby scoffed. "Why would I run from a mere mortal man?"

Mike gave an odd smile, which caused Abby to take a step back. "You're not... ?"

"I am." Flatly, Mike replied. "I have already spoken to your father on this matter and he is very... displeased."

Abby frowned. "What do you want?"

"Information." Calmly, Mike replied. "It's no secret that the last of the Van Helsing clan wants to rekindle the old war between vampires and werewolves. The question is, who roped you into the scheme?"

"Give me one reason why I should give you anything?" Boldly, Abby demanded. "My father is the one and only..."

I was about to speak only Mike spoke first, motioning to me. "Her grandfather is Dracula, and her mother is the daughter of Carmilla Karnstein, his first wife." Ice in his voice, he interrupted. "You are nothing but a spoiled rich girl who happens to be a vampire."

"And the werewolf... ?" Scowling, Abby demanded.

Tasha opened my mouth to speak, but Mike stopped her with a motion of his hand. "You know very well that she is a berserker werewolf." Coldly, he said. "She is the last girl any vampire with a lick of sense would wish to anger." He gave another odd smile. "You really opened a can of worms talking Loveta into attacking her. Within a few generations, there could be an entire pack of berserker werewolves running amok."

Tasha blushed at that though she tried to hide it. I hid a smile of my own, knowing where Mike was going with his questioning. Abby turned pale, looking at Tasha just as she had put on her poker face, and gulped. "I was contacted by young boy who offered me a large cooler of donated blood in exchange for a few minutes of my time." Softly, she said.

"Go on... " Flatly, Mike said.

"He said his name was Vie Harris."

Mike frowned deeply. "Thank you, Miss D'Arcy." Calmly, he said. "That is all I need to know... think no further on this matter." He again gave an odd smile. "Until you see your father, that is."

Mike then led Tasha and I away from the cemetery back to his car. "What was that all about, detective?" Curious, Tasha asked.

"Vie Harris is like me,... an immortal." To both Tasha's and my shock, Mike said. "We are normal by all human standards, other than the fact we cannot die, unless the host is willingly or unwillingly changed."

"Unless you become a vampire or werewolf." Gulping, I said.

Mike nodded. "Correct." He sighed. "Vie Harris thrives on creating conflict, so I am guessing that the peace efforts are his newest target."

"So... what do we do?" Worried, Tasha asked.

Mike handed each of us a photograph of a young man. "This is your mole." Serious, he said. "He is likely working both sides of the field. Find him, then report to me... he is mine."
1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.title: We question Abby Vamp.

1111221112112111211121322211211232111232.content:
After the creepy talk with Abby D'Arcy, and a rough night driving people to and fro, I decided I needed a drink to steady my nerves. I went back to Nouri's, where I was greeted by the usual greeting, "Janelle!"

I giggled, then sighed, which brought more than a few raised eyebrows and curious looks. "What has you out of sorts?" Curious, Kaptan asked.

"It would seem that one of the bikers who fell to Tasha's parents years ago got away." Darkly, I replied. "An immortal named Vie Harris."

"He's back in town?" Raising and eyebrow, Finn asked.

I nodded. "He's trying to rekindle the fight between the two powers." Frowning, I said. "Apparently, that was his goal the last time he was here."

"So it's round two." Frowning, Greene said.

I nodded. "Mike Sutherland wants him, and so do Tasha's parents."

"You should have known you will eventually face a conflict of interests." Serious, Blasko said. "Both powers want him, so it will be a race."

"I'm going to need a drink." Sighing, I said.

Finn nodded and gave me a tall order of the gore special. "Any idea of how you are going to handle this?" Curious, he asked.

Before I could answer, a tall, dark man in a black business suit walked in and took a seat next to me. Ignoring the cold glares from the cabbies, he looked me square in the eye with a hint of a smile. "Good evening, Miss Lee." Calmly, he said. "My name is Vie Harris, and I would like to have a word with you, if I may."

The cabbies did well to hide their surprise, as did I. "My mentor, Detective Mike Sutherland, is more interested in a conversation with you."

"Ah, yes, the immortal detective." Ruefully, Vie said. "Our issues are rather... involved, but I am not here to discuss him."

"State your business, immortal." Darkly, I said. "Before I get thirsty enough for even your tasteless blood."

Vie chuckled. "You have your mother's temperament, I admire that." He then turned serious. "I have lived long enough to know that a resistance left alone becomes a new empire, toppling the old. The werewolf empire is gaining strength, but I can help you topple that empire, by weakening it at its very foundation."

It was obvious that Vie was trying to manipulate me, but I found it comical, almost sad, that he did not know I was a part of the peace process. "Keep talking." Softly, I said.

Vie smiled. "I know the werewolf trying to manipulate the vampires into softening their position." Smiling, he said. "She is the daughter of the king and queen of all berserkers, Tasha Lyall. She is young, inexperienced, and vulnerable." He chuckled. "Clearly no match for the granddaughter of Dracula himself."

"What's your plan?" Frowning, I demanded.

"I can arrange for the two of you to meet at the masquerade festival, one day before the full moon." Darkly, Vie said. "She will be at her weakest then, and you will be able to take her down swiftly, and gain the powers of the berserkers on top of your vampire strength through her blood."

I had to bite my tongue to keep myself from laughing in the immortal's face. He clearly had no idea, and was almost literally giving himself to us. "The festival will be filled with normals, immortal." Frowning, I pointed out.

Vie smiled. "True... but there will be plenty of distractions, so no one will raise an eyebrow at a girl dancing with the devil under the pale moonlight."

I nodded, though I had no intention to follow his plan. Vie nodded back and casually walked out into the darkness of the night. After he was gone, I turned to Greene, who allowed a slight chuckle to escape his lips. "This could be interesting."

We all shared a chuckle before I began to enjoy my gore special.

1112.content:
"OH MY GOODNESS! Is that blood? Are you really drinking blood?"

I give her a weak smile, unable to utter a word. This is crazy! What must my family think? Hold up, what do I think about all this?

Courtney let out a loud shriek. "Are those fangs? How cool is this? I take back all the times I claimed you were the most boring, cliche sister. You are officially the BEST big sister!"

Well, I guess I knew how one of my family members felt about this mess. "Gee, thanks, Court, way to make a girl feel special."

"Oh you are special,... now! Let me get a closer look at your fangs," she exclaimed as she started to approach me.

"Courtney! Stop!" my mom exclaimed while pulling Courtney back towards her. "Don't move closer, it could be dangerous."

My stomach dropped. Dangerous. My mom thought I was dangerous. Was I dangerous? I didn't feel dangerous, but, then again, I wasn't sure what I was feeling.

"Honey!" my dad scolded. "That's our daughter."

"I know that's our daughter, but....."

"But nothing"

Yep, folks, that's my family. I love my parents, I do. And, believe it or not, they adore each other, and my sister and myself. But they also loved to argue. Of course, if you asked them, they "never argued". They just had passionate discussions.

While they were "passionately discussing" me, Courtney took that opportunity to come closer to me. "They will be at it for a while. So, can I see your fangs?" she asked undauntedly.

I opened my mouth to allow her to study to her heart's content. After a moment I asked, "Aren't you freaked out at all by this?"

"Are you kidding? This is the best day of my life. I can't wait to see how many of the vampire cliches are true. How will sunlight affect you? Will you sparkle, turn to dust, or will it just be a little uncomfortable? What about real food? Will you be able to enter homes without permission? Will you need to sleep? Will you have other powers?" she gushed.

"Whoa! Slow down, kid. This might seem like a really amazing experience for you, but I was just attacked, and woke up in a morgue. I'm a little overwhelmed here, and you are not making it any easier." If I still had breath in my body, I am sure I would be hyperventilating by now.

Courtney had the good sense to look sheepish. "Sorry. Don't worry." she said while taking my hand. The one that wasn't still holding the bagged blood. "I know a lot about vampires. You aren't alone."

13.content:
Making other vampires: This is accomplished by injecting a special venom through the fangs into someone drained to the point of death. This is usually deliberate, although some vampires may do it out of excitement.

Strength: A vampire's strength is twenty times what their mortal strength was.

Speed: Vampires can move faster than the human eye can follow.

Agility: A waking vampire is always sure-footed.

Stealth: If a vampire doesn't want to be heard, you won't hear them.

Senses: Vampiric senses are far more acute than a human's.

Leaping: Vampires can jump 50 feet into the air with ease.

Hypnosis: Vampires can dominate a weak-willed opponent.

Recovery from injury: If it won't destroy a vampire, they can recover from it, often within a night or two.

The following are powers possessed by only vampires who are several centuries into their undead existence:

Flight: Older vampires can take to the skies.

Metamorphosis: Older vampires can change their shape, though this takes a great deal of energy. Typically used to make an escape, or a stylish entrance.

Pyrokinesis: Older vampires can start fires by thinking about it.
13.title: Vampire Powers

14.content:
Blood: Vampires need it to survive. A full-fledged vampire can only consume blood. Human blood is strongly preferred. Typically, a pint or two will get them through the night, although more may be needed if they've been exerting themselves.

Daytime: Vampires must rest when the sun comes up. They must rest for a minimum of six hours, after which they may move about. Coffins are unnecessary, just a place that is safe from sunlight and intruders.

Sunlight: Direct sunlight causes vampires intense pain. If they must go out during the day, they cover up to block the rays.

Silver: Vampires have an almost allergic reaction to silver. They can sense its presence, and prefer to avoid it. Recovery is swift after the silver is removed.*

Running water: Vampires cannot cross running water by their own power: they must be carried. Modern vampires can, and do, take showers to combat body odor, since the means to shut off the water is within the shower.

Invitation only: Vampires can only enter a home if they have been invited to do so. Of course, said invitation can come in different ways, including a mat emblazoned with the word WELCOME. Also, once they're let in, they can come and go as they please.

Stake through the heart: Contrary to popular belief, a stake will not kill a vampire outright. However, it will render the vampire paralyzed, enabling a vampire hunter to take more permanent action. If the stake is removed, the vampire will swiftly recover.

Decapitation: This will permanently destroy a vampire. However, do not expect to get the job done in one swing, unless you are much stronger than average.

Fire: This, too, will destroy a vampire permanently. You will need a lot to get the job done, so be cautious.

* This is the reason behind vampires' legendary aversion to mirrors. Mirrors were once made with silver backing. Modern mirrors are made with aluminum backing, so vampires are no longer repelled by mirrors.
